ZLib.description: [ZLib](https://attack.mitre.org/software/S0086) has the ability to enumerate files and drives.

ZLib.name: Remote File Copy
ZLib.description: [ZLib](https://attack.mitre.org/software/S0086) has the ability to download files.

ZLib.name: Masquerading
ZLib.description: [ZLib](https://attack.mitre.org/software/S0086) mimics the resource version information of legitimate Realtek Semiconductor, Nvidia, or Synaptics modules.

ZLib.name: New Service
ZLib.description: [ZLib](https://attack.mitre.org/software/S0086) creates Registry keys to allow itself to run as various services.

ZLib.name: System Service Discovery
ZLib.description: [ZLib](https://attack.mitre.org/software/S0086) has the ability to discover and manipulate Windows services.

Orz.name: Regsvr32
Orz.description: Some [Orz](https://attack.mitre.org/software/S0229) versions have an embedded DLL known as MockDll that uses [Process Hollowing](https://attack.mitre.org/techniques/T1093) and regsvr32 to execute another payload.

Orz.name: Process Discovery
Orz.description: [Orz](https://attack.mitre.org/software/S0229) can gather a process list from the victim.

Orz.name: Indicator Removal on Host
Orz.description: [Orz](https://attack.mitre.org/software/S0229) can overwrite Registry settings to reduce its visibility on the victim.

Orz.name: Obfuscated Files or Information
Orz.description: Some [Orz](https://attack.mitre.org/software/S0229) strings are base64 encoded, such as the embedded DLL known as MockDll.

Orz.name: Process Hollowing
Orz.description: Some [Orz](https://attack.mitre.org/software/S0229) versions have an embedded DLL known as MockDll that uses process hollowing and [Regsvr32](https://attack.mitre.org/techniques/T1117) to execute another payload.

Orz.name: Scripting
Orz.description: [Orz](https://attack.mitre.org/software/S0229) can execute commands with script as well as execute JavaScript.

Orz.name: System Information Discovery
Orz.description: [Orz](https://attack.mitre.org/software/S0229) can gather the victim OS version and whether it is 64 or 32 bit.

Orz.name: Remote File Copy
Orz.description: [Orz](https://attack.mitre.org/software/S0229) can download files onto the victim.

Orz.name: Web Service
Orz.description: [Orz](https://attack.mitre.org/software/S0229) has used Technet and Pastebin web pages for command and control.

PlugX.name: Execution through API
PlugX.description: [PlugX](https://attack.mitre.org/software/S0013) can use the Windows API function CreateProcess to execute another process.

PlugX.name: Process Discovery
PlugX.description: [PlugX](https://attack.mitre.org/software/S0013) has a module to list the processes running on a machine.

PlugX.name: Input Capture
PlugX.description: [PlugX](https://attack.mitre.org/software/S0013) has a module for capturing keystrokes per process including window titles.

PlugX.name: Deobfuscate/Decode Files or Information
PlugX.description: [PlugX](https://attack.mitre.org/software/S0013) decompresses and decrypts itself using the Microsoft API call RtlDecompressBuffer.

PlugX.name: DLL Side-Loading
PlugX.description: [PlugX](https://attack.mitre.org/software/S0013) has used DLL side-loading to evade anti-virus.

PlugX.name: Multiband Communication
PlugX.description: [PlugX](https://attack.mitre.org/software/S0013) can be configured to use multiple network protocols to avoid network-based detection.

PlugX.name: File and Directory Discovery
PlugX.description: [PlugX](https://attack.mitre.org/software/S0013) has a module to enumerate drives and find files recursively.

PlugX.name: Standard Application Layer Protocol
PlugX.description: [PlugX](https://attack.mitre.org/software/S0013) can be configured to use HTTP or DNS for command and control.

PlugX.name: Command-Line Interface
PlugX.description: [PlugX](https://attack.mitre.org/software/S0013) allows actors to spawn a reverse shell on a victim.

PlugX.name: Screen Capture
PlugX.description: [PlugX](https://attack.mitre.org/software/S0013) allows the operator to capture screenshots.

PlugX.name: Modify Registry
PlugX.description: [PlugX](https://attack.mitre.org/software/S0013) has a module to create, delete, or modify Registry keys.

PlugX.name: Commonly Used Port
PlugX.description: [PlugX](https://attack.mitre.org/software/S0013) has beaconed to its C2 over port 443.

PlugX.name: Modify Existing Service
PlugX.description: [PlugX](https://attack.mitre.org/software/S0013) has a module to change service configurations as well as start, control, and delete services.

PlugX.name: Query Registry
PlugX.description: [PlugX](https://attack.mitre.org/software/S0013) can enumerate and query for information contained within the Windows Registry.

PlugX.name: Trusted Developer Utilities
PlugX.description: A version of [PlugX](https://attack.mitre.org/software/S0013) loads as shellcode within a .NET Framework project using msbuild.exe, presumably to bypass application whitelisting techniques.

PlugX.name: Remote File Copy
PlugX.description: [PlugX](https://attack.mitre.org/software/S0013) has a module to download and execute files on the compromised machine.

PlugX.name: Web Service
PlugX.description: [PlugX](https://attack.mitre.org/software/S0013) uses Pastebin to store C2 addresses.

PlugX.name: Custom Command and Control Protocol
PlugX.description: [PlugX](https://attack.mitre.org/software/S0013) can be configured to use raw TCP or UDP for command and control.

PlugX.name: New Service
PlugX.description: [PlugX](https://attack.mitre.org/software/S0013) can be added as a service to establish persistence.

PlugX.name: Masquerading
PlugX.description: In one instance, [menuPass](https://attack.mitre.org/groups/G0045) added [PlugX](https://attack.mitre.org/software/S0013) as a service with a display name of "Corel Writing Tools Utility."

PlugX.name: Standard Non-Application Layer Protocol
PlugX.description: [PlugX](https://attack.mitre.org/software/S0013) can be configured to use raw TCP or UDP for command and control.

PlugX.name: Registry Run Keys / Startup Folder
PlugX.description: [PlugX](https://attack.mitre.org/software/S0013) adds Run key entries in the Registry to establish persistence.

PlugX.name: Network Share Discovery
PlugX.description: [PlugX](https://attack.mitre.org/software/S0013) has a module to enumerate network shares.

PlugX.name: System Network Connections Discovery
PlugX.description: [PlugX](https://attack.mitre.org/software/S0013) has a module for enumerating TCP and UDP network connections and associated processes using the netstat command.

PlugX.name: Virtualization/Sandbox Evasion
PlugX.description: [PlugX](https://attack.mitre.org/software/S0013) checks if VMware tools is running in the background by searching for any process named "vmtoolsd".

Remsec.name: System Information Discovery
Remsec.description: [Remsec](https://attack.mitre.org/software/S0125) can obtain the OS version information, computer name, processor architecture, machine role, and OS edition.

Remsec.name: File Deletion
Remsec.description: [Remsec](https://attack.mitre.org/software/S0125) is capable of deleting files on the victim. It also securely removes itself after collecting and exfiltrating data.

Remsec.name: Custom Command and Control Protocol
Remsec.description: [Remsec](https://attack.mitre.org/software/S0125) is capable of using ICMP, TCP, and UDP for C2.

Remsec.name: Standard Application Layer Protocol
Remsec.description: [Remsec](https://attack.mitre.org/software/S0125) is capable of using HTTP, HTTPS, SMTP, and DNS for C2.

Remsec.name: Exfiltration Over Physical Medium
Remsec.description: [Remsec](https://attack.mitre.org/software/S0125) contains a module to move data from airgapped networks to Internet-connected systems by using a removable USB device.

Remsec.name: Input Capture
Remsec.description: [Remsec](https://attack.mitre.org/software/S0125) contains a keylogger component.

Remsec.name: Network Service Scanning
Remsec.description: [Remsec](https://attack.mitre.org/software/S0125) has a plugin that can perform ARP scanning as well as port scanning.

Remsec.name: Exfiltration Over Alternative Protocol
Remsec.description: [Remsec](https://attack.mitre.org/software/S0125) can exfiltrate data via a DNS tunnel or email, separately from its C2 channel.

Remsec.name: Standard Cryptographic Protocol
Remsec.description: [Remsec](https://attack.mitre.org/software/S0125)'s network loader encrypts C2 traffic with RSA and RC6.

Remsec.name: Masquerading
Remsec.description: The [Remsec](https://attack.mitre.org/software/S0125) loader implements itself with the name Security Support Provider, a legitimate Windows function. Various [Remsec](https://attack.mitre.org/software/S0125) .exe files mimic legitimate file names used by Microsoft, Symantec, Kaspersky, Hewlett-Packard, and VMWare. [Remsec](https://attack.mitre.org/software/S0125) also disguised malicious modules using similar filenames as custom network encryption software on victims.

Remsec.name: Process Injection
Remsec.description: [Remsec](https://attack.mitre.org/software/S0125) can perform DLL injection.

Remsec.name: Standard Non-Application Layer Protocol
Remsec.description: [Remsec](https://attack.mitre.org/software/S0125) is capable of using ICMP, TCP, and UDP for C2.

Remsec.name: Data from Removable Media
Remsec.description: [Remsec](https://attack.mitre.org/software/S0125) has a package that collects documents from any inserted USB sticks.

Remsec.name: System Network Connections Discovery
Remsec.description: [Remsec](https://attack.mitre.org/software/S0125) can obtain a list of active connections and open ports.

Remsec.name: Obfuscated Files or Information
Remsec.description: Some data in [Remsec](https://attack.mitre.org/software/S0125) is encrypted using RC5 in CBC mode, AES-CBC with a hardcoded key, RC4, or Salsa20. Some data is also base64-encoded.

Remsec.name: System Owner/User Discovery
Remsec.description: [Remsec](https://attack.mitre.org/software/S0125) can obtain information about the current user.

Remsec.name: Security Software Discovery
Remsec.description: [Remsec](https://attack.mitre.org/software/S0125) has a plugin to detect active drivers of some security products.

Remsec.name: Uncommonly Used Port
Remsec.description: A [Remsec](https://attack.mitre.org/software/S0125) module has a default C2 port of 13000.

Remsec.name: Credential Dumping
Remsec.description: [Remsec](https://attack.mitre.org/software/S0125) can dump the SAM database.

Remsec.name: Remote File Copy
Remsec.description: [Remsec](https://attack.mitre.org/software/S0125) contains a network loader to receive executable modules from remote attackers and run them on the local victim. It can also upload and download files over HTTP and HTTPS.

Remsec.name: Exploitation for Privilege Escalation
Remsec.description: [Remsec](https://attack.mitre.org/software/S0125) has a plugin to drop and execute vulnerable Outpost Sandbox or avast! Virtualization drivers in order to gain kernel mode privileges.

Remsec.name: Disabling Security Tools
Remsec.description: [Remsec](https://attack.mitre.org/software/S0125) can add or remove applications or ports on the Windows firewall or disable it entirely.

Remsec.name: File and Directory Discovery
Remsec.description: [Remsec](https://attack.mitre.org/software/S0125) is capable of listing contents of folders on the victim. [Remsec](https://attack.mitre.org/software/S0125) also searches for custom network encryption software on victims.

Remsec.name: Process Discovery
Remsec.description: [Remsec](https://attack.mitre.org/software/S0125) can obtain a process list from the victim.

Remsec.name: Password Filter DLL
Remsec.description: [Remsec](https://attack.mitre.org/software/S0125) harvests plain-text credentials as a password filter registered on domain controllers.

Remsec.name: Remote System Discovery
Remsec.description: [Remsec](https://attack.mitre.org/software/S0125) can ping or traceroute a remote host.

Remsec.name: Scheduled Task
Remsec.description: [Remsec](https://attack.mitre.org/software/S0125) schedules the execution one of its modules by creating a new scheduler task.

Remsec.name: Account Discovery
Remsec.description: [Remsec](https://attack.mitre.org/software/S0125) can obtain a list of users.

Remsec.name: System Network Configuration Discovery
Remsec.description: [Remsec](https://attack.mitre.org/software/S0125) can obtain information about network configuration, including the routing table, ARP cache, and DNS cache.

Gold Dragon.name: System Owner/User Discovery
Gold Dragon.description: [Gold Dragon](https://attack.mitre.org/software/S0249) collects the endpoint victim's username and uses it as a basis for downloading additional components from the C2 server.

Gold Dragon.name: Command-Line Interface
Gold Dragon.description: [Gold Dragon](https://attack.mitre.org/software/S0249) uses cmd.exe to execute commands for discovery.

Gold Dragon.name: Registry Run Keys / Startup Folder
Gold Dragon.description: [Gold Dragon](https://attack.mitre.org/software/S0249) establishes persistence in the Startup folder.

Gold Dragon.name: File Deletion
Gold Dragon.description: [Gold Dragon](https://attack.mitre.org/software/S0249) deletes one of its files, 2.hwp, from the endpoint after establishing persistence.

Gold Dragon.name: Remote File Copy
Gold Dragon.description: [Gold Dragon](https://attack.mitre.org/software/S0249) can download additional components from the C2 server.

Gold Dragon.name: Disabling Security Tools
Gold Dragon.description: [Gold Dragon](https://attack.mitre.org/software/S0249) terminates anti-malware processes if they’re found running on the system.

Gold Dragon.name: Process Discovery
Gold Dragon.description: [Gold Dragon](https://attack.mitre.org/software/S0249) checks the running processes on the victim’s machine.

Gold Dragon.name: Query Registry
Gold Dragon.description: [Gold Dragon](https://attack.mitre.org/software/S0249) enumerates registry keys with the command regkeyenum and obtains information for the Registry key HKEY_CURRENT_USER\SOFTWARE\Microsoft\Windows\CurrentVersion\Run.

Gold Dragon.name: System Information Discovery
Gold Dragon.description: [Gold Dragon](https://attack.mitre.org/software/S0249) collects endpoint information using the systeminfo command.

Gold Dragon.name: Security Software Discovery
Gold Dragon.description: [Gold Dragon](https://attack.mitre.org/software/S0249) checks for anti-malware products and processes.

Gold Dragon.name: Standard Application Layer Protocol
Gold Dragon.description: [Gold Dragon](https://attack.mitre.org/software/S0249) uses HTTP for communication to the control servers.

Gold Dragon.name: Data Encrypted
Gold Dragon.description: [Gold Dragon](https://attack.mitre.org/software/S0249) encrypts data using Base64 before being sent to the command and control server.

Gold Dragon.name: Data Staged
Gold Dragon.description: [Gold Dragon](https://attack.mitre.org/software/S0249) stores information gathered from the endpoint in a file named 1.hwp.

Gold Dragon.name: File and Directory Discovery
Gold Dragon.description: [Gold Dragon](https://attack.mitre.org/software/S0249) lists the directories for Desktop, program files, and the user’s recently accessed files.

yty.name: Scheduled Task
yty.description: [yty](https://attack.mitre.org/software/S0248) establishes persistence by creating a scheduled task with the command SchTasks /Create /SC DAILY /TN BigData /TR “ + path_file + “/ST 09:30“.

yty.name: Remote System Discovery
yty.description: [yty](https://attack.mitre.org/software/S0248) uses the net view command for discovery.

yty.name: Binary Padding
yty.description: [yty](https://attack.mitre.org/software/S0248) contains junk code in its binary, likely to confuse malware analysts.

yty.name: Masquerading
yty.description: [yty](https://attack.mitre.org/software/S0248) contains several references to football (including "football," "score," "ball," and "loose") in a likely attempt to disguise its traffic.

yty.name: System Information Discovery
yty.description: [yty](https://attack.mitre.org/software/S0248) gathers the computer name, the serial number of the main disk volume, CPU information, Microsoft Windows version, and runs the command systeminfo.

yty.name: File and Directory Discovery
yty.description: [yty](https://attack.mitre.org/software/S0248) gathers information on victim’s drives and has a plugin for document listing.

yty.name: System Network Configuration Discovery
yty.description: [yty](https://attack.mitre.org/software/S0248) runs ipconfig /all and collects the domain name.

yty.name: Data from Local System
yty.description: [yty](https://attack.mitre.org/software/S0248) collects files with the following extensions: .ppt, .pptx, .pdf, .doc, .docx, .xls, .xlsx, .docm, .rtf, .inp, .xlsm, .csv, .odt, .pps, .vcf and sends them back to the C2 server.

yty.name: Input Capture
yty.description: [yty](https://attack.mitre.org/software/S0248) uses a keylogger plugin to gather keystrokes.

yty.name: Screen Capture
yty.description: [yty](https://attack.mitre.org/software/S0248) collects screenshots of the victim machine.

yty.name: Web Service
yty.description: [yty](https://attack.mitre.org/software/S0248) communicates to the C2 server by retrieving a Google Doc.

yty.name: Process Discovery
yty.description: [yty](https://attack.mitre.org/software/S0248) gets an output of running processes using the tasklist command.

yty.name: Virtualization/Sandbox Evasion
yty.description: [yty](https://attack.mitre.org/software/S0248) has some basic anti-sandbox detection that tries to detect Virtual PC, Sandboxie, and VMware.

VERMIN.name: File Deletion
VERMIN.description: [VERMIN](https://attack.mitre.org/software/S0257) can delete files on the victim’s machine.

VERMIN.name: Remote File Copy
VERMIN.description: [VERMIN](https://attack.mitre.org/software/S0257) can download and upload files to the victim's machine.

VERMIN.name: Automated Collection
VERMIN.description: [VERMIN](https://attack.mitre.org/software/S0257) saves each collected file with the automatically generated format {0:dd-MM-yyyy}.txt .

VERMIN.name: Security Software Discovery
VERMIN.description: [VERMIN](https://attack.mitre.org/software/S0257) uses WMI to check for anti-virus software installed on the system.

VERMIN.name: System Information Discovery
VERMIN.description: [VERMIN](https://attack.mitre.org/software/S0257) collects the OS name, machine name, and architecture information.

VERMIN.name: Process Discovery
VERMIN.description: [VERMIN](https://attack.mitre.org/software/S0257) can get a list of the processes and running tasks on the system.

VERMIN.name: Deobfuscate/Decode Files or Information
VERMIN.description: [VERMIN](https://attack.mitre.org/software/S0257) decrypts code, strings, and commands to use once it's on the victim's machine.

VERMIN.name: Screen Capture
VERMIN.description: [VERMIN](https://attack.mitre.org/software/S0257) can perform screen captures of the victim’s machine.

VERMIN.name: Clipboard Data
VERMIN.description: [VERMIN](https://attack.mitre.org/software/S0257) collects data stored in the clipboard.

VERMIN.name: System Owner/User Discovery
VERMIN.description: [VERMIN](https://attack.mitre.org/software/S0257) gathers the username from the victim’s machine.

VERMIN.name: Obfuscated Files or Information
VERMIN.description: [VERMIN](https://attack.mitre.org/software/S0257) is obfuscated using the obfuscation tool called ConfuserEx.

VERMIN.name: Input Capture
VERMIN.description: [VERMIN](https://attack.mitre.org/software/S0257) collects keystrokes from the victim machine.

ZeroT.name: System Information Discovery
ZeroT.description: [ZeroT](https://attack.mitre.org/software/S0230) gathers the victim's computer name, Windows version, and system language, and then sends it to its C2 server.

ZeroT.name: System Network Configuration Discovery
ZeroT.description: [ZeroT](https://attack.mitre.org/software/S0230) gathers the victim's IP address and domain information, and then sends it to its C2 server.

ZeroT.name: Bypass User Account Control
ZeroT.description: Many [ZeroT](https://attack.mitre.org/software/S0230) samples can perform UAC bypass by using eventvwr.exe to execute a malicious file.

ZeroT.name: New Service
ZeroT.description: [ZeroT](https://attack.mitre.org/software/S0230) can add a new service to ensure [PlugX](https://attack.mitre.org/software/S0013) persists on the system when delivered as another payload onto the system.

ZeroT.name: Data Obfuscation
ZeroT.description: [ZeroT](https://attack.mitre.org/software/S0230) has retrieved stage 2 payloads as Bitmap images that use Least Significant Bit (LSB) steganography.

ZeroT.name: Binary Padding
ZeroT.description: [ZeroT](https://attack.mitre.org/software/S0230) has obfuscated DLLs and functions using dummy API calls inserted between real instructions.

ZeroT.name: Software Packing
ZeroT.description: Some [ZeroT](https://attack.mitre.org/software/S0230) DLL files have been packed with UPX.

ZeroT.name: DLL Side-Loading
ZeroT.description: [ZeroT](https://attack.mitre.org/software/S0230) has used DLL side-loading to load malicious payloads.

ZeroT.name: Obfuscated Files or Information
ZeroT.description: [ZeroT](https://attack.mitre.org/software/S0230) has encrypted its payload with RC4.

ZeroT.name: Deobfuscate/Decode Files or Information
ZeroT.description: [ZeroT](https://attack.mitre.org/software/S0230) shellcode decrypts and decompresses its RC4-encrypted payload.

ZeroT.name: Remote File Copy
ZeroT.description: [ZeroT](https://attack.mitre.org/software/S0230) can download additional payloads onto the victim.

ZeroT.name: Standard Cryptographic Protocol
ZeroT.description: [ZeroT](https://attack.mitre.org/software/S0230) has used RC4 to encrypt C2 traffic.

RunningRAT.name: Scripting
RunningRAT.description: [RunningRAT](https://attack.mitre.org/software/S0253) uses a batch file to kill a security program task and then attempts to remove itself.

RunningRAT.name: File Deletion
RunningRAT.description: [RunningRAT](https://attack.mitre.org/software/S0253) contains code to delete files from the victim’s machine.

RunningRAT.name: Input Capture
RunningRAT.description: [RunningRAT](https://attack.mitre.org/software/S0253) captures keystrokes and sends them back to the C2 server.

RunningRAT.name: Clipboard Data
RunningRAT.description: [RunningRAT](https://attack.mitre.org/software/S0253) contains code to open and copy data from the clipboard.

RunningRAT.name: Registry Run Keys / Startup Folder
RunningRAT.description: [RunningRAT](https://attack.mitre.org/software/S0253) adds itself to the Registry key Software\Microsoft\Windows\CurrentVersion\Run to establish persistence upon reboot.

RunningRAT.name: System Information Discovery
RunningRAT.description: [RunningRAT](https://attack.mitre.org/software/S0253) gathers the OS version, logical drives information, processor information, and volume information.

RunningRAT.name: Indicator Removal on Host
RunningRAT.description: [RunningRAT](https://attack.mitre.org/software/S0253) contains code to clear event logs.

Rover.name: Screen Capture
Rover.description: [Rover](https://attack.mitre.org/software/S0090) takes screenshots of the compromised system's desktop and saves them to C:\system\screenshot.bmp for exfiltration every 60 minutes.

Rover.name: Modify Registry
Rover.description: [Rover](https://attack.mitre.org/software/S0090) has functionality to remove Registry Run key persistence as a cleanup procedure.

Rover.name: Data from Removable Media
Rover.description: [Rover](https://attack.mitre.org/software/S0090) searches for files on attached removable drives based on a predefined list of file extensions every five seconds.

Rover.name: Data Staged
Rover.description: [Rover](https://attack.mitre.org/software/S0090) copies files from removable drives to C:\system.

Rover.name: Automated Collection
Rover.description: [Rover](https://attack.mitre.org/software/S0090) automatically collects files from the local system and removable drives based on a predefined list of file extensions on a regular timeframe.

Rover.name: Registry Run Keys / Startup Folder
Rover.description: [Rover](https://attack.mitre.org/software/S0090) persists by creating a Registry entry in HKEY_CURRENT_USER\SOFTWARE\Microsoft\Windows\CurrentVersion\Run\.

Rover.name: Automated Exfiltration
Rover.description: [Rover](https://attack.mitre.org/software/S0090) automatically searches for files on local drives based on a predefined list of file extensions and sends them to the command and control server every 60 minutes. [Rover](https://attack.mitre.org/software/S0090) also automatically sends keylogger files and screenshots to the C2 server on a regular timeframe.

Rover.name: Data from Local System
Rover.description: [Rover](https://attack.mitre.org/software/S0090) searches for files on local drives based on a predefined list of file extensions.

Rover.name: File and Directory Discovery
Rover.description: [Rover](https://attack.mitre.org/software/S0090) automatically searches for files on local drives based on a predefined list of file extensions.

DownPaper.name: Registry Run Keys / Startup Folder
DownPaper.description: [DownPaper](https://attack.mitre.org/software/S0186) uses PowerShell to add a Registry Run key in order to establish persistence.

DownPaper.name: Standard Application Layer Protocol
DownPaper.description: [DownPaper](https://attack.mitre.org/software/S0186) communicates to its C2 server over HTTP.

DownPaper.name: System Owner/User Discovery
DownPaper.description: [DownPaper](https://attack.mitre.org/software/S0186) collects the victim username and sends it to the C2 server.

DownPaper.name: Query Registry
DownPaper.description: [DownPaper](https://attack.mitre.org/software/S0186) searches and reads the value of the Windows Update Registry Run key.

DownPaper.name: System Information Discovery
DownPaper.description: [DownPaper](https://attack.mitre.org/software/S0186) collects the victim host name and serial number, and then sends the information to the C2 server.

Dyre.name: Process Injection
Dyre.description: [Dyre](https://attack.mitre.org/software/S0024) injects into other processes to load modules.

Dyre.name: Remote File Copy
Dyre.description: [Dyre](https://attack.mitre.org/software/S0024) has a command to download and executes additional files.

Dyre.name: New Service
Dyre.description: [Dyre](https://attack.mitre.org/software/S0024) registers itself as a service by adding several Registry keys.

Dyre.name: Virtualization/Sandbox Evasion
Dyre.description: [Dyre](https://attack.mitre.org/software/S0024) can detect sandbox analysis environments by inspecting the process list and Registry.

Dyre.name: Deobfuscate/Decode Files or Information
Dyre.description: [Dyre](https://attack.mitre.org/software/S0024) decrypts resources needed for targeting the victim.

QUADAGENT.name: File Deletion
QUADAGENT.description: [QUADAGENT](https://attack.mitre.org/software/S0269) has a command to delete its Registry key and scheduled task.

QUADAGENT.name: Modify Registry
QUADAGENT.description: [QUADAGENT](https://attack.mitre.org/software/S0269) modifies an HKCU Registry key to store a session identifier unique to the compromised system as well as a pre-shared key used for encrypting and decrypting C2 communications.

QUADAGENT.name: Command-Line Interface
QUADAGENT.description: [QUADAGENT](https://attack.mitre.org/software/S0269) uses cmd.exe to execute scripts and commands on the victim’s machine.

QUADAGENT.name: Deobfuscate/Decode Files or Information
QUADAGENT.description: [QUADAGENT](https://attack.mitre.org/software/S0269) uses AES and a preshared key to decrypt the custom Base64 routine used to encode strings and scripts.

QUADAGENT.name: Scheduled Task
QUADAGENT.description: [QUADAGENT](https://attack.mitre.org/software/S0269) creates a scheduled task to maintain persistence on the victim’s machine.

QUADAGENT.name: System Network Configuration Discovery
QUADAGENT.description: [QUADAGENT](https://attack.mitre.org/software/S0269) gathers the current domain the victim system belongs to.

QUADAGENT.name: Standard Application Layer Protocol
QUADAGENT.description: [QUADAGENT](https://attack.mitre.org/software/S0269) uses HTTPS, HTTP, and DNS for C2 communications.

QUADAGENT.name: Fallback Channels
QUADAGENT.description: [QUADAGENT](https://attack.mitre.org/software/S0269) uses multiple protocols (HTTPS, HTTP, DNS) for its C2 server as fallback channels if communication with one is unsuccessful.

QUADAGENT.name: Query Registry
QUADAGENT.description: [QUADAGENT](https://attack.mitre.org/software/S0269) checks if a value exists within a Registry key in the HKCU hive whose name is the same as the scheduled task it has created.

Wiarp.name: Commonly Used Port
Wiarp.description: [Wiarp](https://attack.mitre.org/software/S0206) connects to external C2 infrastructure over the HTTP port.

Wiarp.name: New Service
Wiarp.description: [Wiarp](https://attack.mitre.org/software/S0206) creates a backdoor through which remote attackers can create a service.

Wiarp.name: Process Injection
Wiarp.description: [Wiarp](https://attack.mitre.org/software/S0206) creates a backdoor through which remote attackers can inject files into running processes.

Wiarp.name: Command-Line Interface
Wiarp.description: [Wiarp](https://attack.mitre.org/software/S0206) creates a backdoor through which remote attackers can open a command line interface.

Wiarp.name: Remote File Copy
Wiarp.description: [Wiarp](https://attack.mitre.org/software/S0206) creates a backdoor through which remote attackers can download files.

China Chopper.name: Command-Line Interface
China Chopper.description: [China Chopper](https://attack.mitre.org/software/S0020)'s server component is capable of opening a command terminal.

China Chopper.name: Remote File Copy
China Chopper.description: [China Chopper](https://attack.mitre.org/software/S0020)'s server component can download remote files.

China Chopper.name: File and Directory Discovery
China Chopper.description: [China Chopper](https://attack.mitre.org/software/S0020)'s server component can list directory contents.

China Chopper.name: Standard Application Layer Protocol
China Chopper.description: [China Chopper](https://attack.mitre.org/software/S0020)'s server component executes code sent via HTTP POST commands.

China Chopper.name: Web Shell
China Chopper.description: [China Chopper](https://attack.mitre.org/software/S0020)'s server component is a Web Shell payload.

China Chopper.name: Data from Local System
China Chopper.description: [China Chopper](https://attack.mitre.org/software/S0020)'s server component can upload local files.

China Chopper.name: Network Service Scanning
China Chopper.description: [China Chopper](https://attack.mitre.org/software/S0020)'s server component can spider authentication portals.

China Chopper.name: Brute Force
China Chopper.description: [China Chopper](https://attack.mitre.org/software/S0020)'s server component can perform brute force password guessing against authentication portals.

China Chopper.name: Software Packing
China Chopper.description: [China Chopper](https://attack.mitre.org/software/S0020)'s client component is packed with UPX.

China Chopper.name: Scripting
China Chopper.description: [China Chopper](https://attack.mitre.org/software/S0020)'s server component is a text based payload available in a variety of scripting languages.

China Chopper.name: Timestomp
China Chopper.description: [China Chopper](https://attack.mitre.org/software/S0020)'s server component can change the timestamp of files.

Kasidet.name: Disabling Security Tools
Kasidet.description: [Kasidet](https://attack.mitre.org/software/S0088) has the ability to change firewall settings to allow a plug-in to be downloaded.

Kasidet.name: Security Software Discovery
Kasidet.description: [Kasidet](https://attack.mitre.org/software/S0088) has the ability to identify any anti-virus installed on the infected system.

Kasidet.name: Screen Capture
Kasidet.description: [Kasidet](https://attack.mitre.org/software/S0088) has the ability to initiate keylogging and screen captures.

Kasidet.name: File and Directory Discovery
Kasidet.description: [Kasidet](https://attack.mitre.org/software/S0088) has the ability to search for a given filename on a victim.

Kasidet.name: Remote File Copy
Kasidet.description: [Kasidet](https://attack.mitre.org/software/S0088) has the ability to download and execute additional files.

Kasidet.name: System Information Discovery
Kasidet.description: [Kasidet](https://attack.mitre.org/software/S0088) has the ability to obtain a victim's system name and operating system version.

Kasidet.name: Registry Run Keys / Startup Folder
Kasidet.description: [Kasidet](https://attack.mitre.org/software/S0088) creates a Registry Run key to establish persistence.

Kasidet.name: Input Capture
Kasidet.description: [Kasidet](https://attack.mitre.org/software/S0088) has the ability to initiate keylogging.

Kasidet.name: Process Discovery
Kasidet.description: [Kasidet](https://attack.mitre.org/software/S0088) has the ability to search for a given process name in processes currently running in the system.

PHOREAL.name: Command-Line Interface
PHOREAL.description: [PHOREAL](https://attack.mitre.org/software/S0158) is capable of creating reverse shell.

PHOREAL.name: Modify Registry
PHOREAL.description: [PHOREAL](https://attack.mitre.org/software/S0158) is capable of manipulating the Registry.

PUNCHBUGGY.name: Execution through Module Load
PUNCHBUGGY.description: [PUNCHBUGGY](https://attack.mitre.org/software/S0196) can load a DLL using the LoadLibrary API.

PUNCHBUGGY.name: Remote File Copy
PUNCHBUGGY.description: [PUNCHBUGGY](https://attack.mitre.org/software/S0196) can download additional files and payloads to compromised hosts.

PUNCHBUGGY.name: Registry Run Keys / Startup Folder
PUNCHBUGGY.description: [PUNCHBUGGY](https://attack.mitre.org/software/S0196) has been observed using a Registry Run key.

PUNCHBUGGY.name: Rundll32
PUNCHBUGGY.description: [PUNCHBUGGY](https://attack.mitre.org/software/S0196) can load a DLL using Rundll32.

PUNCHBUGGY.name: Masquerading
PUNCHBUGGY.description: [PUNCHBUGGY](https://attack.mitre.org/software/S0196) mimics filenames from %SYSTEM%\System32 to hide DLLs in %WINDIR% and/or %TEMP%.

PUNCHBUGGY.name: Standard Application Layer Protocol
PUNCHBUGGY.description: [PUNCHBUGGY](https://attack.mitre.org/software/S0196) enables remote interaction and can obtain additional code over HTTPS GET and POST requests.

PUNCHBUGGY.name: AppCert DLLs
PUNCHBUGGY.description: [PUNCHBUGGY](https://attack.mitre.org/software/S0196) can establish using a AppCertDLLs Registry key.

PUNCHBUGGY.name: File Deletion
PUNCHBUGGY.description: [PUNCHBUGGY](https://attack.mitre.org/software/S0196) can delete files written to disk.

PUNCHBUGGY.name: Data Compressed
PUNCHBUGGY.description: [PUNCHBUGGY](https://attack.mitre.org/software/S0196) has Gzipped information and saved it to a random temp file before exfil.

PUNCHBUGGY.name: Permission Groups Discovery
PUNCHBUGGY.description: [PUNCHBUGGY](https://attack.mitre.org/software/S0196) can gather domain and workgroup information.

PUNCHBUGGY.name: Security Software Discovery
PUNCHBUGGY.description: [PUNCHBUGGY](https://attack.mitre.org/software/S0196) can gather AVs registered in the system.

PUNCHBUGGY.name: System Information Discovery
PUNCHBUGGY.description: [PUNCHBUGGY](https://attack.mitre.org/software/S0196) can gather system information such as computer names.

PUNCHBUGGY.name: Scripting
PUNCHBUGGY.description: [PUNCHBUGGY](https://attack.mitre.org/software/S0196) has used [PowerShell](https://attack.mitre.org/techniques/T1086), python, and shellcode scripts.

PUNCHBUGGY.name: Deobfuscate/Decode Files or Information
PUNCHBUGGY.description: [PUNCHBUGGY](https://attack.mitre.org/software/S0196) has used [PowerShell](https://attack.mitre.org/techniques/T1086) to decode base64-encoded assembly.

PUNCHBUGGY.name: Obfuscated Files or Information
PUNCHBUGGY.description: [PUNCHBUGGY](https://attack.mitre.org/software/S0196) has hashed most its code's functions and encrypted payloads with base64 and XOR.

PUNCHBUGGY.name: Data Staged
PUNCHBUGGY.description: [PUNCHBUGGY](https://attack.mitre.org/software/S0196) has saved information to a random temp file before exfil.

TDTESS.name: Timestomp
TDTESS.description: After creating a new service for persistence, [TDTESS](https://attack.mitre.org/software/S0164) sets the file creation time for the service to the creation time of the victim's legitimate svchost.exe file.

TDTESS.name: Command-Line Interface
TDTESS.description: [TDTESS](https://attack.mitre.org/software/S0164) provides a reverse shell on the victim.

TDTESS.name: File Deletion
TDTESS.description: [TDTESS](https://attack.mitre.org/software/S0164) creates then deletes log files during installation of itself as a service.

TDTESS.name: New Service
TDTESS.description: If running as administrator, [TDTESS](https://attack.mitre.org/software/S0164) installs itself as a new service named bmwappushservice to establish persistence.

TDTESS.name: Remote File Copy
TDTESS.description: [TDTESS](https://attack.mitre.org/software/S0164) has a command to download and execute an additional file.

StreamEx.name: Modify Registry
StreamEx.description: [StreamEx](https://attack.mitre.org/software/S0142) has the ability to modify the Registry.

StreamEx.name: File and Directory Discovery
StreamEx.description: [StreamEx](https://attack.mitre.org/software/S0142) has the ability to enumerate drive types.

StreamEx.name: Rundll32
StreamEx.description: [StreamEx](https://attack.mitre.org/software/S0142) uses rundll32 to call an exported function.

StreamEx.name: Security Software Discovery
StreamEx.description: [StreamEx](https://attack.mitre.org/software/S0142) has the ability to scan for security tools such as firewalls and antivirus tools.

StreamEx.name: Command-Line Interface
StreamEx.description: [StreamEx](https://attack.mitre.org/software/S0142) has the ability to remotely execute commands.

StreamEx.name: System Information Discovery
StreamEx.description: [StreamEx](https://attack.mitre.org/software/S0142) has the ability to enumerate system information.

StreamEx.name: Process Discovery
StreamEx.description: [StreamEx](https://attack.mitre.org/software/S0142) has the ability to enumerate processes.

StreamEx.name: Obfuscated Files or Information
StreamEx.description: [StreamEx](https://attack.mitre.org/software/S0142) obfuscates some commands by using statically programmed fragments of strings when starting a DLL. It also uses a one-byte xor against 0x91 to encode configuration data.

StreamEx.name: New Service
StreamEx.description: [StreamEx](https://attack.mitre.org/software/S0142) establishes persistence by installing a new service pointing to its DLL and setting the service to auto-start.

ROKRAT.name: Screen Capture
ROKRAT.description: [ROKRAT](https://attack.mitre.org/software/S0240) captures screenshots of the infected system.

ROKRAT.name: System Information Discovery
ROKRAT.description: [ROKRAT](https://attack.mitre.org/software/S0240) gathers the computer name and checks the OS version to ensure it doesn’t run on a Windows XP or Windows Server 2003 systems.

ROKRAT.name: Query Registry
ROKRAT.description: [ROKRAT](https://attack.mitre.org/software/S0240) accesses the HKLM\System\CurrentControlSet\Services\mssmbios\Data\SMBiosData Registry key to obtain the System manufacturer value to identify the machine type.

ROKRAT.name: Exfiltration Over Command and Control Channel
ROKRAT.description: [ROKRAT](https://attack.mitre.org/software/S0240) sends collected files back over same C2 channel.

ROKRAT.name: Web Service
ROKRAT.description: [ROKRAT](https://attack.mitre.org/software/S0240) leverages legitimate social networking sites and cloud platforms (Twitter, Yandex, and Mediafire) for command and control communications.

ROKRAT.name: Standard Application Layer Protocol
ROKRAT.description: [ROKRAT](https://attack.mitre.org/software/S0240) use HTTPS for all command and control communication methods.

ROKRAT.name: Remote File Copy
ROKRAT.description: [ROKRAT](https://attack.mitre.org/software/S0240) retrieves additional malicious payloads from the C2 server.

ROKRAT.name: Process Discovery
ROKRAT.description: [ROKRAT](https://attack.mitre.org/software/S0240) lists the current running processes on the system.

ROKRAT.name: Credential Dumping
ROKRAT.description: [ROKRAT](https://attack.mitre.org/software/S0240) steals credentials stored in Web browsers by querying the sqlite database and leveraging the Windows Vault mechanism.

ROKRAT.name: Input Capture
ROKRAT.description: [ROKRAT](https://attack.mitre.org/software/S0240) uses a keylogger to capture keystrokes and location of where the user is typing.

ROKRAT.name: File and Directory Discovery
ROKRAT.description: [ROKRAT](https://attack.mitre.org/software/S0240) has the ability to gather a list of files and directories on the infected system.

ROKRAT.name: Audio Capture
ROKRAT.description: [ROKRAT](https://attack.mitre.org/software/S0240) has a audio capture and eavesdropping module.

Unknown Logger.name: System Owner/User Discovery
Unknown Logger.description: [Unknown Logger](https://attack.mitre.org/software/S0130) can obtain information about the victim usernames.

Unknown Logger.name: Credential Dumping
Unknown Logger.description: [Unknown Logger](https://attack.mitre.org/software/S0130) is capable of stealing usernames and passwords from browsers on the victim machine.

Unknown Logger.name: Replication Through Removable Media
Unknown Logger.description: [Unknown Logger](https://attack.mitre.org/software/S0130) is capable of spreading to USB devices.

Unknown Logger.description: [Unknown Logger](https://attack.mitre.org/software/S0130) can obtain information about the victim's IP address.

Unknown Logger.description: [Unknown Logger](https://attack.mitre.org/software/S0130) is capable of downloading remote files.

Unknown Logger.description: [Unknown Logger](https://attack.mitre.org/software/S0130) has functionality to disable security tools, including Kaspersky, BitDefender, and MalwareBytes.

LOWBALL.name: Commonly Used Port
LOWBALL.description: [LOWBALL](https://attack.mitre.org/software/S0042) command and control occurs via HTTPS over port 443.

LOWBALL.name: Standard Application Layer Protocol
LOWBALL.description: [LOWBALL](https://attack.mitre.org/software/S0042) command and control occurs via HTTPS over port 443.

LOWBALL.name: Web Service
LOWBALL.description: [LOWBALL](https://attack.mitre.org/software/S0042) uses the Dropbox cloud storage service for command and control.

LOWBALL.name: Remote File Copy
LOWBALL.description: [LOWBALL](https://attack.mitre.org/software/S0042) uses the Dropbox API to request two files, one of which is the same file as the one dropped by the malicious email attachment. This is most likely meant to be a mechanism to update the compromised host with a new version of the [LOWBALL](https://attack.mitre.org/software/S0042) malware.

RARSTONE.name: Process Injection
RARSTONE.description: After decrypting itself in memory, [RARSTONE](https://attack.mitre.org/software/S0055) downloads a DLL file from its C2 server and loads it in the memory space of a hidden Internet Explorer process. This “downloaded” file is actually not dropped onto the system.

RARSTONE.name: Standard Application Layer Protocol
RARSTONE.description: [RARSTONE](https://attack.mitre.org/software/S0055) uses SSL to encrypt its communication with its C2 server.

RARSTONE.name: File and Directory Discovery
RARSTONE.description: [RARSTONE](https://attack.mitre.org/software/S0055) obtains installer properties from Uninstall Registry Key entries to obtain information about installed applications and how to uninstall certain applications.

RARSTONE.name: Remote File Copy
RARSTONE.description: [RARSTONE](https://attack.mitre.org/software/S0055) downloads its backdoor component from a C2 server and loads it directly into memory.

jRAT.name: Video Capture
jRAT.description: [jRAT](https://attack.mitre.org/software/S0283) has the capability to capture video from a webcam.

jRAT.name: File Deletion
jRAT.description: [jRAT](https://attack.mitre.org/software/S0283) has a function to delete files from the victim’s machine.

jRAT.name: Obfuscated Files or Information
jRAT.description: [jRAT](https://attack.mitre.org/software/S0283)’s Java payload is encrypted with AES. Additionally, backdoor files are encrypted using DES as a stream cipher. Later variants of [jRAT](https://attack.mitre.org/software/S0283) also incorporated AV evasion methods such as Java bytecode obfuscation via the commercial Allatori obfuscation tool.

jRAT.name: Security Software Discovery
jRAT.description: [jRAT](https://attack.mitre.org/software/S0283) can list security software, such as by using WMIC to identify anti-virus products installed on the victim’s machine and to obtain firewall details.

jRAT.name: Remote File Copy
jRAT.description: [jRAT](https://attack.mitre.org/software/S0283) can download and execute files.

jRAT.name: Screen Capture
jRAT.description: [jRAT](https://attack.mitre.org/software/S0283) has the capability to take screenshots of the victim’s machine.

jRAT.name: Input Capture
jRAT.description: [jRAT](https://attack.mitre.org/software/S0283) has the capability to log keystrokes from the victim’s machine, both offline and online.

jRAT.name: Windows Management Instrumentation
jRAT.description: [jRAT](https://attack.mitre.org/software/S0283) uses WMIC to identify anti-virus products installed on the victim’s machine and to obtain firewall details.

jRAT.name: File and Directory Discovery
jRAT.description: [jRAT](https://attack.mitre.org/software/S0283) can browse file systems.

jRAT.name: Process Discovery
jRAT.description: [jRAT](https://attack.mitre.org/software/S0283) can query and kill system processes.

jRAT.name: System Information Discovery
jRAT.description: [jRAT](https://attack.mitre.org/software/S0283) collects information about the OS (version, build type, install date) as well as system up-time upon receiving a connection from a backdoor.

jRAT.name: Scripting
jRAT.description: [jRAT](https://attack.mitre.org/software/S0283) has been distributed as HTA files with VBScript+JScript.

jRAT.name: System Network Connections Discovery
jRAT.description: [jRAT](https://attack.mitre.org/software/S0283) can list network connections.

jRAT.name: Software Packing
jRAT.description: [jRAT](https://attack.mitre.org/software/S0283) payloads have been packed.

jRAT.name: Command-Line Interface
jRAT.description: [jRAT](https://attack.mitre.org/software/S0283) has command line access.

jRAT.name: Startup Items
jRAT.description: [jRAT](https://attack.mitre.org/software/S0283) can list and manage startup entries.

jRAT.name: System Service Discovery
jRAT.description: [jRAT](https://attack.mitre.org/software/S0283) can list local services.

jRAT.name: Audio Capture
jRAT.description: [jRAT](https://attack.mitre.org/software/S0283) can capture microphone recordings.

jRAT.name: Private Keys
jRAT.description: [jRAT](https://attack.mitre.org/software/S0283) can steal keys for VPNs and cryptocurrency wallets.

jRAT.name: Clipboard Data
jRAT.description: [jRAT](https://attack.mitre.org/software/S0283) can capture clipboard data.

jRAT.name: Remote Desktop Protocol
jRAT.description: [jRAT](https://attack.mitre.org/software/S0283) can support RDP control.

jRAT.name: Connection Proxy
jRAT.description: [jRAT](https://attack.mitre.org/software/S0283) can serve as a SOCKS proxy server.

jRAT.name: Peripheral Device Discovery
jRAT.description: [jRAT](https://attack.mitre.org/software/S0283) can map UPnP ports.

jRAT.name: System Network Configuration Discovery
jRAT.description: [jRAT](https://attack.mitre.org/software/S0283) can gather victim internal and external IPs.

jRAT.name: Scheduled Transfer
jRAT.description: [jRAT](https://attack.mitre.org/software/S0283) can be configured to reconnect at certain intervals.

jRAT.name: Credentials in Files
jRAT.description: [jRAT](https://attack.mitre.org/software/S0283) can capture passwords from common chat applications such as MSN Messenger, AOL, Instant Messenger, and and Google Talk.

Proxysvc.name: Commonly Used Port
Proxysvc.description: [Proxysvc](https://attack.mitre.org/software/S0238) uses port 443 for the control server communications.

Proxysvc.name: System Time Discovery
Proxysvc.description: As part of the data reconnaissance phase, [Proxysvc](https://attack.mitre.org/software/S0238) grabs the system time to send back to the control server.

Proxysvc.name: Scripting
Proxysvc.description: [Proxysvc](https://attack.mitre.org/software/S0238) uses a batch file to delete itself.

Proxysvc.name: Standard Application Layer Protocol
Proxysvc.description: [Proxysvc](https://attack.mitre.org/software/S0238) uses HTTP over SSL to communicate commands with the control server.

Proxysvc.name: Automated Collection
Proxysvc.description: [Proxysvc](https://attack.mitre.org/software/S0238) automatically collects data about the victim and sends it to the control server.

Proxysvc.name: System Network Configuration Discovery
Proxysvc.description: [Proxysvc](https://attack.mitre.org/software/S0238) collects the network adapter information and domain/username information based on current remote sessions.

Proxysvc.name: Data from Local System
Proxysvc.description: [Proxysvc](https://attack.mitre.org/software/S0238) searches the local system and gathers data.

Proxysvc.name: Service Execution
Proxysvc.description: [Proxysvc](https://attack.mitre.org/software/S0238) registers itself as a service on the victim’s machine to run as a standalone process.

Proxysvc.name: Process Discovery
Proxysvc.description: [Proxysvc](https://attack.mitre.org/software/S0238) lists processes running on the system.

Proxysvc.name: Command-Line Interface
Proxysvc.description: [Proxysvc](https://attack.mitre.org/software/S0238) executes a binary on the system and logs the results into a temp file by using: cmd.exe /c " > %temp%\PM* .tmp 2>&1".

Proxysvc.name: System Information Discovery
Proxysvc.description: [Proxysvc](https://attack.mitre.org/software/S0238) collects the OS version, country name, MAC address, computer name, physical memory statistics, and volume information for all drives on the system.

Proxysvc.name: Exfiltration Over Command and Control Channel
Proxysvc.description: [Proxysvc](https://attack.mitre.org/software/S0238) performs data exfiltration over the control server channel using a custom protocol.

Proxysvc.name: Query Registry
Proxysvc.description: [Proxysvc](https://attack.mitre.org/software/S0238) gathers product names from the Registry key: HKLM\Software\Microsoft\Windows NT\CurrentVersion ProductName and the processor description from the Registry key HKLM\HARDWARE\DESCRIPTION\System\CentralProcessor\0 ProcessorNameString.

Proxysvc.name: File Deletion
Proxysvc.description: [Proxysvc](https://attack.mitre.org/software/S0238) can delete files indicated by the attacker and remove itself from disk using a batch file.

Proxysvc.name: Data Destruction
Proxysvc.description: [Proxysvc](https://attack.mitre.org/software/S0238) can overwrite files indicated by the attacker before deleting them.

T9000.name: Audio Capture
T9000.description: [T9000](https://attack.mitre.org/software/S0098) uses the Skype API to record audio and video calls. It writes encrypted data to %APPDATA%\Intel\Skype.

T9000.name: System Time Discovery
T9000.description: [T9000](https://attack.mitre.org/software/S0098) gathers and beacons the system time during installation.

T9000.name: System Owner/User Discovery
T9000.description: [T9000](https://attack.mitre.org/software/S0098) gathers and beacons the username of the logged in account during installation. It will also gather the username of running processes to determine if it is running as SYSTEM.

T9000.name: Data Encrypted
T9000.description: [T9000](https://attack.mitre.org/software/S0098) encrypts collected data using a single byte XOR key.

T9000.name: Video Capture
T9000.description: [T9000](https://attack.mitre.org/software/S0098) uses the Skype API to record audio and video calls. It writes encrypted data to %APPDATA%\Intel\Skype.

T9000.name: Screen Capture
T9000.description: [T9000](https://attack.mitre.org/software/S0098) can take screenshots of the desktop and target application windows, saving them to user directories as one byte XOR encrypted .dat files.

T9000.name: Security Software Discovery
T9000.description: [T9000](https://attack.mitre.org/software/S0098) performs checks for various antivirus and security products during installation.

T9000.name: AppInit DLLs
T9000.description: If a victim meets certain criteria, [T9000](https://attack.mitre.org/software/S0098) uses the AppInit_DLL functionality to achieve persistence by ensuring that every user mode process that is spawned will load its malicious DLL, ResN32.dll. It does this by creating the following Registry keys: HKLM\Software\Microsoft\Windows NT\CurrentVersion\Windows\AppInit_DLLs – %APPDATA%\Intel\ResN32.dll and HKLM\Software\Microsoft\Windows NT\CurrentVersion\Windows\LoadAppInit_DLLs – 0x1.

T9000.name: Peripheral Device Discovery
T9000.description: [T9000](https://attack.mitre.org/software/S0098) searches through connected drives for removable storage devices.

T9000.name: DLL Side-Loading
T9000.description: During the [T9000](https://attack.mitre.org/software/S0098) installation process, it drops a copy of the legitimate Microsoft binary igfxtray.exe. The executable contains a side-loading weakness which is used to load a portion of the malware.

T9000.name: System Network Configuration Discovery
T9000.description: [T9000](https://attack.mitre.org/software/S0098) gathers and beacons the MAC and IP addresses during installation.

T9000.name: Automated Collection
T9000.description: [T9000](https://attack.mitre.org/software/S0098) searches removable storage devices for files with a pre-defined list of file extensions (e.g. * .doc, *.ppt, *.xls, *.docx, *.pptx, *.xlsx). Any matching files are encrypted and written to a local user directory.

T9000.name: System Information Discovery
T9000.description: [T9000](https://attack.mitre.org/software/S0098) gathers and beacons the operating system build number and CPU Architecture (32-bit/64-bit) during installation.

SeaDuke.name: Data Compressed
SeaDuke.description: [SeaDuke](https://attack.mitre.org/software/S0053) compressed data with zlib prior to sending it over C2.

SeaDuke.name: PowerShell
SeaDuke.description: [SeaDuke](https://attack.mitre.org/software/S0053) uses a module to execute Mimikatz with PowerShell to perform [Pass the Ticket](https://attack.mitre.org/techniques/T1097).

SeaDuke.name: Pass the Ticket
SeaDuke.description: Some [SeaDuke](https://attack.mitre.org/software/S0053) samples have a module to use pass the ticket with Kerberos for authentication.

SeaDuke.name: Shortcut Modification
SeaDuke.description: [SeaDuke](https://attack.mitre.org/software/S0053) is capable of persisting via a .lnk file stored in the Startup directory.

SeaDuke.name: Standard Cryptographic Protocol
SeaDuke.description: [SeaDuke](https://attack.mitre.org/software/S0053) C2 traffic has been encrypted with RC4 and AES.

SeaDuke.name: Software Packing
SeaDuke.description: [SeaDuke](https://attack.mitre.org/software/S0053) has been packed with the UPX packer.

SeaDuke.name: Valid Accounts
SeaDuke.description: Some [SeaDuke](https://attack.mitre.org/software/S0053) samples have a module to extract email from Microsoft Exchange servers using compromised credentials.

SeaDuke.name: Windows Management Instrumentation Event Subscription
SeaDuke.description: [SeaDuke](https://attack.mitre.org/software/S0053) uses an event filter in WMI code to execute a previously dropped executable shortly after system startup.

SeaDuke.name: Remote File Copy
SeaDuke.description: [SeaDuke](https://attack.mitre.org/software/S0053) is capable of uploading and downloading files.

SeaDuke.name: File Deletion
SeaDuke.description: [SeaDuke](https://attack.mitre.org/software/S0053) can securely delete files, including deleting itself from the victim.

SeaDuke.name: Standard Application Layer Protocol
SeaDuke.description: [SeaDuke](https://attack.mitre.org/software/S0053) uses HTTP and HTTPS for C2.

SeaDuke.name: Email Collection
SeaDuke.description: Some [SeaDuke](https://attack.mitre.org/software/S0053) samples have a module to extract email from Microsoft Exchange servers using compromised credentials.

SeaDuke.name: Scripting
SeaDuke.description: [SeaDuke](https://attack.mitre.org/software/S0053) uses a module to execute Mimikatz with PowerShell to perform [Pass the Ticket](https://attack.mitre.org/techniques/T1097).

SeaDuke.name: Registry Run Keys / Startup Folder
SeaDuke.description: [SeaDuke](https://attack.mitre.org/software/S0053) is capable of persisting via the Registry Run key or a .lnk file stored in the Startup directory.

RogueRobin.name: Shortcut Modification
RogueRobin.description: [RogueRobin](https://attack.mitre.org/software/S0270) establishes persistence by creating a shortcut (.LNK file) in the Windows startup folder to run a script each time the user logs in.

RogueRobin.name: Data Obfuscation
RogueRobin.description: [RogueRobin](https://attack.mitre.org/software/S0270) base64 encodes strings that are sent to the C2 over its DNS tunnel.

RogueRobin.name: Obfuscated Files or Information
RogueRobin.description: The PowerShell script with the [RogueRobin](https://attack.mitre.org/software/S0270) payload was obfuscated using the COMPRESS technique in Invoke-Obfuscation.

RogueRobin.name: PowerShell
RogueRobin.description: [RogueRobin](https://attack.mitre.org/software/S0270) uses PowerShell for execution.

RogueRobin.name: Remote File Copy
RogueRobin.description: [RogueRobin](https://attack.mitre.org/software/S0270) can save a new file to the system from the C2 server.

RogueRobin.name: Windows Management Instrumentation
RogueRobin.description: [RogueRobin](https://attack.mitre.org/software/S0270) uses various WMI queries to check if the sample is running in a sandbox.

RogueRobin.name: Registry Run Keys / Startup Folder
RogueRobin.description: [RogueRobin](https://attack.mitre.org/software/S0270) created a shortcut in the Windows startup folder to launch a PowerShell script each time the user logs in to establish persistence.

RogueRobin.name: Command-Line Interface
RogueRobin.description: [RogueRobin](https://attack.mitre.org/software/S0270) uses a command prompt to run a PowerShell script from Excel.

RogueRobin.name: Security Software Discovery
RogueRobin.description: [RogueRobin](https://attack.mitre.org/software/S0270) enumerates running processes to search for Wireshark and Windows Sysinternals suite.

RogueRobin.name: Scripting
RogueRobin.description: To assist in establishing persistence, [RogueRobin](https://attack.mitre.org/software/S0270) creates %APPDATA%\OneDrive.bat and saves the following string to it:powershell.exe -WindowStyle Hidden -exec bypass -File “%APPDATA%\OneDrive.ps1”. [RogueRobin](https://attack.mitre.org/software/S0270) also uses Windows Script Components.

RogueRobin.name: Screen Capture
RogueRobin.description: [RogueRobin](https://attack.mitre.org/software/S0270) has a command named $screenshot that may be responsible for taking screenshots of the victim machine.

RogueRobin.name: System Information Discovery
RogueRobin.description: [RogueRobin](https://attack.mitre.org/software/S0270) gathers BIOS versions and manufacturers, the number of CPU cores, the total physical memory, and the computer name.

RogueRobin.name: System Network Configuration Discovery
RogueRobin.description: [RogueRobin](https://attack.mitre.org/software/S0270) gathers the IP address and domain from the victim’s machine.

RogueRobin.name: Process Discovery
RogueRobin.description: [RogueRobin](https://attack.mitre.org/software/S0270) checks the running processes for evidence it may be running in a sandbox environment. It specifically enumerates processes for Wireshark and Sysinternals.

RogueRobin.name: System Owner/User Discovery
RogueRobin.description: [RogueRobin](https://attack.mitre.org/software/S0270) collects the victim’s username and whether that user is an admin.

RogueRobin.name: Custom Command and Control Protocol
RogueRobin.description: [RogueRobin](https://attack.mitre.org/software/S0270) uses a custom DNS tunneling protocol for C2.

RogueRobin.name: Web Service
RogueRobin.description: [RogueRobin](https://attack.mitre.org/software/S0270) has used Google Drive as a Command and Control channel.

RogueRobin.name: Virtualization/Sandbox Evasion
RogueRobin.description: [RogueRobin](https://attack.mitre.org/software/S0270) uses WMI to check BIOS version for VBOX, bochs, qemu, virtualbox, and vm to check for evidence that the script might be executing within an analysis environment.

RogueRobin.name: Deobfuscate/Decode Files or Information
RogueRobin.description: [RogueRobin](https://attack.mitre.org/software/S0270) decodes an embedded executable using base64 and decompresses it.

RogueRobin.name: Regsvr32
RogueRobin.description: [RogueRobin](https://attack.mitre.org/software/S0270) uses regsvr32.exe to run a .sct file for execution.

Gazer.name: Registry Run Keys / Startup Folder
Gazer.description: [Gazer](https://attack.mitre.org/software/S0168) can establish persistence by creating a .lnk file in the Start menu.

Gazer.name: System Owner/User Discovery
Gazer.description: [Gazer](https://attack.mitre.org/software/S0168) obtains the current user's security identifier.

Gazer.name: Winlogon Helper DLL
Gazer.description: [Gazer](https://attack.mitre.org/software/S0168) can establish persistence by setting the value “Shell” with “explorer.exe, %malware_pathfile%” under the Registry key HKCU\Software\Microsoft\Windows NT\CurrentVersion\Winlogon.

Gazer.name: Process Injection
Gazer.description: [Gazer](https://attack.mitre.org/software/S0168) performs thread execution hijacking to inject its orchestrator into a running thread from a remote process. [Gazer](https://attack.mitre.org/software/S0168) performs a separate injection of its communication module into an Internet accessible process through which it performs C2.

Gazer.name: Timestomp
Gazer.description: For early [Gazer](https://attack.mitre.org/software/S0168) versions, the compilation timestamp was faked.

Gazer.name: Screensaver
Gazer.description: [Gazer](https://attack.mitre.org/software/S0168) can establish persistence through the system screensaver by configuring it to execute the malware.

Gazer.name: Obfuscated Files or Information
Gazer.description: [Gazer](https://attack.mitre.org/software/S0168) logs its actions into files that are encrypted with 3DES. It also uses RSA to encrypt resources.

Gazer.name: Connection Proxy
Gazer.description: [Gazer](https://attack.mitre.org/software/S0168) identifies a proxy server if it exists and uses it to make HTTP requests.

Gazer.name: Standard Application Layer Protocol
Gazer.description: [Gazer](https://attack.mitre.org/software/S0168) communicates with its C2 servers over HTTP.

Gazer.name: Code Signing
Gazer.description: [Gazer](https://attack.mitre.org/software/S0168) versions are signed with various valid certificates; one was likely faked and issued by Comodo for "Solid Loop Ltd," and another was issued for "Ultimate Computer Support Ltd."

Gazer.name: Custom Cryptographic Protocol
Gazer.description: [Gazer](https://attack.mitre.org/software/S0168) uses custom encryption for C2 using 3DES and RSA.

Gazer.name: Remote File Copy
Gazer.description: [Gazer](https://attack.mitre.org/software/S0168) can execute a task to download a file.

Gazer.name: Shortcut Modification
Gazer.description: [Gazer](https://attack.mitre.org/software/S0168) can establish persistence by creating a .lnk file in the Start menu or by modifying existing .lnk files to execute the malware through cmd.exe.

Gazer.name: File Deletion
Gazer.description: [Gazer](https://attack.mitre.org/software/S0168) has commands to delete files and persistence mechanisms from the victim.

Gazer.name: NTFS File Attributes
Gazer.description: [Gazer](https://attack.mitre.org/software/S0168) stores configuration items in alternate data streams (ADSs) if the Registry is not accessible.

Gazer.name: Scheduled Task
Gazer.description: [Gazer](https://attack.mitre.org/software/S0168) can establish persistence by creating a scheduled task.

KEYMARBLE.name: Remote File Copy
KEYMARBLE.description: [KEYMARBLE](https://attack.mitre.org/software/S0271) can upload files to the victim’s machine and can download additional payloads.

KEYMARBLE.name: Process Discovery
KEYMARBLE.description: [KEYMARBLE](https://attack.mitre.org/software/S0271) can obtain a list of running processes on the system.

KEYMARBLE.name: File Deletion
KEYMARBLE.description: [KEYMARBLE](https://attack.mitre.org/software/S0271) has the capability to delete files off the victim’s machine.

KEYMARBLE.name: Screen Capture
KEYMARBLE.description: [KEYMARBLE](https://attack.mitre.org/software/S0271) can capture screenshots of the victim’s machine.

KEYMARBLE.name: Command-Line Interface
KEYMARBLE.description: [KEYMARBLE](https://attack.mitre.org/software/S0271) can execute shell commands using cmd.exe.

KEYMARBLE.name: Custom Cryptographic Protocol
KEYMARBLE.description: [KEYMARBLE](https://attack.mitre.org/software/S0271) uses a customized XOR algorithm to encrypt C2 communications.

KEYMARBLE.name: System Network Configuration Discovery
KEYMARBLE.description: [KEYMARBLE](https://attack.mitre.org/software/S0271) gathers the MAC address of the victim’s machine.

KEYMARBLE.name: System Information Discovery
KEYMARBLE.description: [KEYMARBLE](https://attack.mitre.org/software/S0271) has the capability to collect the computer name, language settings, the OS version, CPU information, disk devices, and time elapsed since system start.

KEYMARBLE.name: File and Directory Discovery
KEYMARBLE.description: [KEYMARBLE](https://attack.mitre.org/software/S0271) has a command to search for files on the victim’s machine.

KEYMARBLE.name: Modify Registry
KEYMARBLE.description: [KEYMARBLE](https://attack.mitre.org/software/S0271) has a command to create Registry entries for storing data under HKEY_CURRENT_USER\SOFTWARE\Microsoft\WABE\DataPath.

Zeus Panda.name: PowerShell
Zeus Panda.description: [Zeus Panda](https://attack.mitre.org/software/S0330) uses PowerShell to download and execute the payload.

Zeus Panda.name: Security Software Discovery
Zeus Panda.description: [Zeus Panda](https://attack.mitre.org/software/S0330) checks to see if anti-virus, anti-spyware, or firewall products are installed in the victim’s environment.

Zeus Panda.name: Scripting
Zeus Panda.description: [Zeus Panda](https://attack.mitre.org/software/S0330) can launch remote scripts on the victim’s machine.

Zeus Panda.name: System Information Discovery
Zeus Panda.description: [Zeus Panda](https://attack.mitre.org/software/S0330) collects the OS version, system architecture, computer name, product ID, install date, and information on the keyboard mapping to determine the language used on the system.

Zeus Panda.name: Remote File Copy
Zeus Panda.description: [Zeus Panda](https://attack.mitre.org/software/S0330) can download additional malware plug-in modules and execute them on the victim’s machine.

Zeus Panda.name: Obfuscated Files or Information
Zeus Panda.description: [Zeus Panda](https://attack.mitre.org/software/S0330) encrypts strings with XOR and obfuscates the macro code from the initial payload. [Zeus Panda](https://attack.mitre.org/software/S0330) also encrypts all configuration and settings in AES and RC4.

Zeus Panda.name: Process Injection
Zeus Panda.description: [Zeus Panda](https://attack.mitre.org/software/S0330) checks processes on the system and if they meet the necessary requirements, it injects into that process.

Zeus Panda.name: System Time Discovery
Zeus Panda.description: [Zeus Panda](https://attack.mitre.org/software/S0330) collects the current system time (UTC) and sends it back to the C2 server.

Zeus Panda.name: Standard Application Layer Protocol
Zeus Panda.description: [Zeus Panda](https://attack.mitre.org/software/S0330) uses HTTP for C2 communications.

Zeus Panda.name: Screen Capture
Zeus Panda.description: [Zeus Panda](https://attack.mitre.org/software/S0330) can take screenshots of the victim’s machine.

Zeus Panda.name: Hooking
Zeus Panda.description: [Zeus Panda](https://attack.mitre.org/software/S0330) hooks processes by leveraging its own IAT hooked functions.

Zeus Panda.name: File Deletion
Zeus Panda.description: [Zeus Panda](https://attack.mitre.org/software/S0330) has a command to delete a file.

Zeus Panda.name: Registry Run Keys / Startup Folder
Zeus Panda.description: [Zeus Panda](https://attack.mitre.org/software/S0330) adds persistence by creating Registry Run keys.

Zeus Panda.name: Input Capture
Zeus Panda.description: [Zeus Panda](https://attack.mitre.org/software/S0330) can perform keylogging on the victim’s machine by hooking the functions TranslateMessage and WM_KEYDOWN.

Zeus Panda.name: Clipboard Data
Zeus Panda.description: [Zeus Panda](https://attack.mitre.org/software/S0330) can hook GetClipboardData function to watch for clipboard pastes to collect.

Zeus Panda.name: Deobfuscate/Decode Files or Information
Zeus Panda.description: [Zeus Panda](https://attack.mitre.org/software/S0330) decrypts strings in the code during the execution process.

Zeus Panda.name: Command-Line Interface
Zeus Panda.description: [Zeus Panda](https://attack.mitre.org/software/S0330) can launch an interface where it can execute several commands on the victim’s PC.

Zeus Panda.name: Modify Registry
Zeus Panda.description: [Zeus Panda](https://attack.mitre.org/software/S0330) modifies several Registry keys under HKCU\Software\Microsoft\Internet Explorer\ PhishingFilter\ to disable phishing filters.

Zeus Panda.name: File and Directory Discovery
Zeus Panda.description: [Zeus Panda](https://attack.mitre.org/software/S0330) searches for specific directories on the victim’s machine.

Zeus Panda.name: Indicator Removal on Host
Zeus Panda.description: [Zeus Panda](https://attack.mitre.org/software/S0330) can uninstall scripts and delete files to cover its track.

Zeus Panda.name: Process Discovery
Zeus Panda.description: [Zeus Panda](https://attack.mitre.org/software/S0330) checks for running processes on the victim’s machine.

Zeus Panda.name: Query Registry
Zeus Panda.description: [Zeus Panda](https://attack.mitre.org/software/S0330) checks for the existence of a Registry key and if it contains certain values.

DarkComet.name: System Owner/User Discovery
DarkComet.description: [DarkComet](https://attack.mitre.org/software/S0334) gathers the username from the victim’s machine.

DarkComet.name: System Information Discovery
DarkComet.description: [DarkComet](https://attack.mitre.org/software/S0334) can collect the computer name, RAM used, and operating system version from the victim’s machine.

DarkComet.name: Standard Application Layer Protocol
DarkComet.description: [DarkComet](https://attack.mitre.org/software/S0334) can use HTTP for C2 communications.

DarkComet.name: Registry Run Keys / Startup Folder
DarkComet.description: [DarkComet](https://attack.mitre.org/software/S0334) adds several Registry entries to enable automatic execution at every system startup.

DarkComet.name: Video Capture
DarkComet.description: [DarkComet](https://attack.mitre.org/software/S0334) can access the victim’s webcam to take pictures.

DarkComet.name: Scripting
DarkComet.description: [DarkComet](https://attack.mitre.org/software/S0334) can execute various types of scripts on the victim’s machine.

DarkComet.name: Process Discovery
DarkComet.description: [DarkComet](https://attack.mitre.org/software/S0334) can list active processes running on the victim’s machine.

DarkComet.name: Command-Line Interface
DarkComet.description: [DarkComet](https://attack.mitre.org/software/S0334) can launch a remote shell to execute commands on the victim’s machine.

DarkComet.name: Modify Registry
DarkComet.description: [DarkComet](https://attack.mitre.org/software/S0334) adds a Registry value for its installation routine to the Registry Key HKEY_CURRENT_USER\Software\Microsoft\Windows\CurrentVersion\Policies\System Enable LUA=”0” and HKEY_CURRENT_USER\Software\DC3_FEXEC.

DarkComet.name: Disabling Security Tools
DarkComet.description: [DarkComet](https://attack.mitre.org/software/S0334) can disable Security Center functions like anti-virus and the Windows Firewall.

DarkComet.name: Remote Desktop Protocol
DarkComet.description: [DarkComet](https://attack.mitre.org/software/S0334) can open an active screen of the victim’s machine and take control of the mouse and keyboard.

DarkComet.name: Audio Capture
DarkComet.description: [DarkComet](https://attack.mitre.org/software/S0334) can listen in to victims' conversations through the system’s microphone.

DarkComet.name: Remote File Copy
DarkComet.description: [DarkComet](https://attack.mitre.org/software/S0334) can load any files onto the infected machine to execute.

DarkComet.name: Software Packing
DarkComet.description: [DarkComet](https://attack.mitre.org/software/S0334) has the option to compress its payload using UPX or MPRESS.

DarkComet.name: Clipboard Data
DarkComet.description: [DarkComet](https://attack.mitre.org/software/S0334) can steal data from the clipboard.

DarkComet.name: Masquerading
DarkComet.description: [DarkComet](https://attack.mitre.org/software/S0334) has dropped itself onto victim machines with file names such as WinDefender.Exe and winupdate.exe in an apparent attempt to masquerade as legitimate.

Carbon.name: Scheduled Task
Carbon.description: [Carbon](https://attack.mitre.org/software/S0335) creates several tasks for later execution to continue persistence on the victim’s machine.

Carbon.name: Account Discovery
Carbon.description: [Carbon](https://attack.mitre.org/software/S0335) runs the net group command to list accounts on the system.

Carbon.name: Standard Non-Application Layer Protocol
Carbon.description: [Carbon](https://attack.mitre.org/software/S0335) uses TCP and UDP for C2.

Carbon.name: System Time Discovery
Carbon.description: [Carbon](https://attack.mitre.org/software/S0335) uses the command net time \\127.0.0.1 to get information the system’s time.

Carbon.name: Process Discovery
Carbon.description: [Carbon](https://attack.mitre.org/software/S0335) can list the processes on the victim’s machine.

Carbon.name: Obfuscated Files or Information
Carbon.description: [Carbon](https://attack.mitre.org/software/S0335) encrypts configuration files and tasks for the malware to complete using CAST-128 algorithm.

Carbon.name: New Service
Carbon.description: [Carbon](https://attack.mitre.org/software/S0335) establishes persistence by creating a service and naming it based off the operating system version running on the current machine.

Carbon.name: Deobfuscate/Decode Files or Information
Carbon.description: [Carbon](https://attack.mitre.org/software/S0335) decrypts task and configuration files for execution.

Carbon.name: Process Injection
Carbon.description: [Carbon](https://attack.mitre.org/software/S0335) has a command to inject code into a process.

Carbon.name: System Network Configuration Discovery
Carbon.description: [Carbon](https://attack.mitre.org/software/S0335) can collect the IP address of the victims and other computers on the network using the commands: ipconfig -all nbtstat -n, and nbtstat -s.

Carbon.name: Data Staged
Carbon.description: [Carbon](https://attack.mitre.org/software/S0335) creates a base directory that contains the files and folders that are collected.

Carbon.name: Exfiltration Over Alternative Protocol
Carbon.description: [Carbon](https://attack.mitre.org/software/S0335) uses HTTP to send data to the C2 server.

Epic.name: Data Compressed
Epic.description: [Epic](https://attack.mitre.org/software/S0091) compresses the collected data with bzip2 before sending it to the C2 server.

Epic.name: System Service Discovery
Epic.description: [Epic](https://attack.mitre.org/software/S0091) uses the tasklist /svc command to list the services on the system.

Epic.name: Remote System Discovery
Epic.description: [Epic](https://attack.mitre.org/software/S0091) uses the net view command on the victim’s machine.

Epic.name: System Time Discovery
Epic.description: [Epic](https://attack.mitre.org/software/S0091) uses the net time command to get the system time from the machine and collect the current date and time zone information.

Epic.name: System Network Connections Discovery
Epic.description: [Epic](https://attack.mitre.org/software/S0091) uses the net use, net session, and netstat commands to gather information on network connections.

Epic.name: File Deletion
Epic.description: [Epic](https://attack.mitre.org/software/S0091) has a command to delete a file from the machine.

Epic.name: Query Registry
Epic.description: [Epic](https://attack.mitre.org/software/S0091) uses the rem reg query command to obtain values from Registry keys.

Epic.name: Standard Application Layer Protocol
Epic.description: [Epic](https://attack.mitre.org/software/S0091) uses HTTP and HTTPS for C2 communications.

Epic.name: File and Directory Discovery
Epic.description: [Epic](https://attack.mitre.org/software/S0091) recursively searches for all .doc files on the system and collects a directory listing of the Desktop, %TEMP%, and %WINDOWS%\Temp directories.

Epic.name: Account Discovery
Epic.description: [Epic](https://attack.mitre.org/software/S0091) gathers a list of all user accounts, privilege classes, and time of last logon.

Epic.name: Security Software Discovery
Epic.description: [Epic](https://attack.mitre.org/software/S0091) searches for anti-malware services running on the victim’s machine and terminates itself if it finds them.

Epic.name: Process Discovery
Epic.description: [Epic](https://attack.mitre.org/software/S0091) uses the tasklist /v command to obtain a list of processes.

Epic.name: Standard Cryptographic Protocol
Epic.description: [Epic](https://attack.mitre.org/software/S0091) encrypts commands from the C2 server using a hardcoded key.

Epic.name: System Owner/User Discovery
Epic.description: [Epic](https://attack.mitre.org/software/S0091) collects the user name from the victim’s machine.

Epic.name: Data Encrypted
Epic.description: [Epic](https://attack.mitre.org/software/S0091) encrypts collected data using a public key framework before sending it over the C2 channel. Some variants encrypt the collected data with AES and encode it with base64 before transmitting it to the C2 server.

Epic.name: Permission Groups Discovery
Epic.description: [Epic](https://attack.mitre.org/software/S0091) gathers information on local group names.

Epic.name: System Information Discovery
Epic.description: [Epic](https://attack.mitre.org/software/S0091) collects the OS version, hardware information, computer name, available system memory status, disk space information, and system and user language settings.

Epic.name: Obfuscated Files or Information
Epic.description: [Epic](https://attack.mitre.org/software/S0091) heavily obfuscates its code to make analysis more difficult.

Epic.name: Code Signing
Epic.description: [Turla](https://attack.mitre.org/groups/G0010) has used valid digital certificates from Sysprint AG to sign its [Epic](https://attack.mitre.org/software/S0091) dropper.
