Pupy.name: Data Compressed
Pupy.description: [Pupy](https://attack.mitre.org/software/S0192) can compress data with Zip before sending it over C2.

Pupy.name: System Owner/User Discovery
Pupy.description: [Pupy](https://attack.mitre.org/software/S0192) can enumerate local information for Linux hosts and find currently logged on users for Windows hosts.

Pupy.name: Audio Capture
Pupy.description: [Pupy](https://attack.mitre.org/software/S0192) can record sound with the microphone.

Pupy.name: Process Injection
Pupy.description: [Pupy](https://attack.mitre.org/software/S0192) can migrate into another process using reflective DLL injection.

Pupy.name: Standard Application Layer Protocol
Pupy.description: [Pupy](https://attack.mitre.org/software/S0192) can communicate over HTTP for C2.

Pupy.name: Remote Desktop Protocol
Pupy.description: [Pupy](https://attack.mitre.org/software/S0192) can enable/disable RDP connection and can start a remote desktop session using a browser web socket client.

Pupy.name: Network Service Scanning
Pupy.description: [Pupy](https://attack.mitre.org/software/S0192) has a built-in module for port scanning.

Pupy.name: LLMNR/NBT-NS Poisoning and Relay
Pupy.description: [Pupy](https://attack.mitre.org/software/S0192) can sniff plaintext network credentials and use NBNS Spoofing to poison name services.

Pupy.name: Email Collection
Pupy.description: [Pupy](https://attack.mitre.org/software/S0192) can interact with a victim’s Outlook session and look through folders and emails.

Pupy.name: Account Discovery
Pupy.description: [Pupy](https://attack.mitre.org/software/S0192) uses PowerView and Pywerview to perform discovery commands such as net user, net group, net local group, etc.

Pupy.name: PowerShell
Pupy.description: [Pupy](https://attack.mitre.org/software/S0192) has a module for loading and executing PowerShell scripts.

Pupy.name: Exfiltration Over Command and Control Channel
Pupy.description: [Pupy](https://attack.mitre.org/software/S0192) can send screenshots files, keylogger data, files, and recorded audio back to the C2 server.

Pupy.name: System Network Connections Discovery
Pupy.description: [Pupy](https://attack.mitre.org/software/S0192) has a built-in utility command for netstat, can do net session through PowerView, and has an interactive shell which can be used to discover additional information.

Pupy.name: System Network Configuration Discovery
Pupy.description: [Pupy](https://attack.mitre.org/software/S0192) has built in commands to identify a host’s IP address and find out other network configuration settings by viewing connected sessions.

Pupy.name: Create Account
Pupy.description: [Pupy](https://attack.mitre.org/software/S0192) can user PowerView to perform “net user” commands and create local system and domain accounts.

Pupy.name: Standard Cryptographic Protocol
Pupy.description: [Pupy](https://attack.mitre.org/software/S0192)'s default encryption for its C2 communication channel is SSL, but it also has transport options for RSA and AES.

Pupy.name: Service Execution
Pupy.description: [Pupy](https://attack.mitre.org/software/S0192) uses [PsExec](https://attack.mitre.org/software/S0029) to execute a payload or commands on a remote host.

Pupy.name: System Information Discovery
Pupy.description: [Pupy](https://attack.mitre.org/software/S0192) can grab a system’s information including the OS version, architecture, etc.

Pupy.name: Network Share Discovery
Pupy.description: [Pupy](https://attack.mitre.org/software/S0192) can list local and remote shared drives and folders over SMB.

Pupy.name: File and Directory Discovery
Pupy.description: [Pupy](https://attack.mitre.org/software/S0192) can walk through directories and recursively search for strings in files.

Pupy.name: Credential Dumping
Pupy.description: [Pupy](https://attack.mitre.org/software/S0192) executes [Mimikatz](https://attack.mitre.org/software/S0002) using PowerShell and can also perform pass-the-ticket and use Lazagne for harvesting credentials.

Pupy.name: Scripting
Pupy.description: [Pupy](https://attack.mitre.org/software/S0192) can use an add on feature when creating payloads that allows you to create custom Python scripts (“scriptlets”) to perform tasks offline (without requiring a session) such as sandbox detection, adding persistence, etc.

Pupy.name: Registry Run Keys / Startup Folder
Pupy.description: [Pupy](https://attack.mitre.org/software/S0192) adds itself to the startup folder or adds itself to the Registry key SOFTWARE\\Microsoft\\Windows\\CurrentVersion\\Run for persistence.

Pupy.name: Video Capture
Pupy.description: [Pupy](https://attack.mitre.org/software/S0192) can access a connected webcam and capture pictures.

Pupy.name: Screen Capture
Pupy.description: [Pupy](https://attack.mitre.org/software/S0192) can drop a mouse-logger that will take small screenshots around at each click and then send back to the server.

Pupy.name: Multilayer Encryption
Pupy.description: [Pupy](https://attack.mitre.org/software/S0192) can use Obfs3, a pluggable transport, to add another layer of encryption and obfuscate TLS.

Pupy.name: Remote File Copy
Pupy.description: [Pupy](https://attack.mitre.org/software/S0192) can upload and download to/from a victim machine.

Pupy.name: Virtualization/Sandbox Evasion
Pupy.description: [Pupy](https://attack.mitre.org/software/S0192) has a module to check if its running on a virtual machine.

Pupy.name: Systemd Service
Pupy.description: [Pupy](https://attack.mitre.org/software/S0192) can be used to establish persistence using a systemd service.

Cobalt Strike.name: Command-Line Interface
Cobalt Strike.description: [Cobalt Strike](https://attack.mitre.org/software/S0154) uses a command-line interface to interact with systems.

Cobalt Strike.name: Scheduled Transfer
Cobalt Strike.description: [Cobalt Strike](https://attack.mitre.org/software/S0154) can set its "beacon" payload to reach out to the C2 server on an arbitrary and random interval. In addition it will break large data sets into smaller chunks for exfiltration.

Cobalt Strike.name: Process Discovery
Cobalt Strike.description: [Cobalt Strike](https://attack.mitre.org/software/S0154)'s "beacon" payload can collect information on process details.

Cobalt Strike.name: Execution through API
Cobalt Strike.description: [Cobalt Strike](https://attack.mitre.org/software/S0154)'s "beacon" payload is capable of running shell commands without cmd.exe and PowerShell commands without powershell.exe

Cobalt Strike.name: New Service
Cobalt Strike.description: [Cobalt Strike](https://attack.mitre.org/software/S0154) can install a new service.

Cobalt Strike.name: Timestomp
Cobalt Strike.description: [Cobalt Strike](https://attack.mitre.org/software/S0154) will timestomp any files or payloads placed on a target machine to help them blend in.

Cobalt Strike.name: Multiband Communication
Cobalt Strike.description: [Cobalt Strike](https://attack.mitre.org/software/S0154)'s "beacon" payload can receive C2 from one protocol and respond on another. This is typically a mixture of HTTP, HTTPS, and DNS traffic.

Cobalt Strike.name: Network Service Scanning
Cobalt Strike.description: [Cobalt Strike](https://attack.mitre.org/software/S0154) can perform port scans from an infected host.

Cobalt Strike.name: Pass the Hash
Cobalt Strike.description: [Cobalt Strike](https://attack.mitre.org/software/S0154) can perform pass the hash.

Cobalt Strike.name: Indicator Removal from Tools
Cobalt Strike.description: [Cobalt Strike](https://attack.mitre.org/software/S0154) includes a capability to modify the "beacon" payload to eliminate known signatures or unpacking methods.

Cobalt Strike.name: PowerShell
Cobalt Strike.description: [Cobalt Strike](https://attack.mitre.org/software/S0154) can execute a payload on a remote host with PowerShell. This technique does not write any data to disk.

Cobalt Strike.name: Windows Admin Shares
Cobalt Strike.description: [Cobalt Strike](https://attack.mitre.org/software/S0154) can use Window admin shares (C$ and ADMIN$) for lateral movement.

Cobalt Strike.name: Valid Accounts
Cobalt Strike.description: [Cobalt Strike](https://attack.mitre.org/software/S0154) can use known credentials to run commands and spawn processes as another user.

Cobalt Strike.name: Windows Remote Management
Cobalt Strike.description: [Cobalt Strike](https://attack.mitre.org/software/S0154) can use WinRM to execute a payload on a remote host.

Cobalt Strike.name: Bypass User Account Control
Cobalt Strike.description: [Cobalt Strike](https://attack.mitre.org/software/S0154) can use a number of known techniques to bypass Windows UAC.

Cobalt Strike.name: Remote Services
Cobalt Strike.description: [Cobalt Strike](https://attack.mitre.org/software/S0154) can SSH to a remote service.

Cobalt Strike.name: Scripting
Cobalt Strike.description: [Cobalt Strike](https://attack.mitre.org/software/S0154) can use [PowerShell](https://attack.mitre.org/techniques/T1086), Python, VBA, [PowerSploit](https://attack.mitre.org/software/S0194), other scripting frameworks to perform execution.

Cobalt Strike.name: Windows Management Instrumentation
Cobalt Strike.description: [Cobalt Strike](https://attack.mitre.org/software/S0154) can use WMI to deliver a payload to a remote host.

Cobalt Strike.name: Exploitation for Privilege Escalation
Cobalt Strike.description: [Cobalt Strike](https://attack.mitre.org/software/S0154) can exploit vulnerabilities such as MS14-058.

Cobalt Strike.name: Custom Command and Control Protocol
Cobalt Strike.description: [Cobalt Strike](https://attack.mitre.org/software/S0154) allows adversaries to modify the way the "beacon" payload communicates. This is called "Malleable C2" in the [Cobalt Strike](https://attack.mitre.org/software/S0154) manual and is intended to allow a penetration test team to mimic known APT C2 methods.

Cobalt Strike.name: Connection Proxy
Cobalt Strike.description: [Cobalt Strike](https://attack.mitre.org/software/S0154) can be configured to have commands relayed over a peer-to-peer network of infected hosts. This can be used to limit the number of egress points, or provide access to a host without direct internet access.

Cobalt Strike.name: Data from Local System
Cobalt Strike.description: [Cobalt Strike](https://attack.mitre.org/software/S0154) can collect data from a local system.

Cobalt Strike.name: Standard Application Layer Protocol
Cobalt Strike.description: [Cobalt Strike](https://attack.mitre.org/software/S0154) uses a custom command and control protocol that is encapsulated in HTTP, HTTPS, or DNS. In addition, it conducts peer-to-peer communication over Windows named pipes encapsulated in the SMB protocol. All protocols use their standard assigned ports.

Cobalt Strike.name: Screen Capture
Cobalt Strike.description: [Cobalt Strike](https://attack.mitre.org/software/S0154)'s "beacon" payload is capable of capturing screen shots.

Cobalt Strike.name: Process Injection
Cobalt Strike.description: [Cobalt Strike](https://attack.mitre.org/software/S0154) can inject a variety of payloads into processes dynamically chosen by the adversary.

Cobalt Strike.name: Access Token Manipulation
Cobalt Strike.description: [Cobalt Strike](https://attack.mitre.org/software/S0154) can steal access tokens from exiting processes and make tokens from known credentials.

Cobalt Strike.name: Service Execution
Cobalt Strike.description: [Cobalt Strike](https://attack.mitre.org/software/S0154) can use [PsExec](https://attack.mitre.org/software/S0029) to execute a payload on a remote host. It can also use Service Control Manager to start new services.

Cobalt Strike.name: Man in the Browser
Cobalt Strike.description: [Cobalt Strike](https://attack.mitre.org/software/S0154) can perform browser pivoting and inject into a user's browser to inherit cookies, authenticated HTTP sessions, and client SSL certificates.

Cobalt Strike.name: Credential Dumping
Cobalt Strike.description: [Cobalt Strike](https://attack.mitre.org/software/S0154) can recover hashed passwords.

Cobalt Strike.name: Remote Desktop Protocol
Cobalt Strike.description: [Cobalt Strike](https://attack.mitre.org/software/S0154) can start a VNC-based remote desktop server and tunnel the connection through the already established C2 channel.

Cobalt Strike.name: Input Capture
Cobalt Strike.description: [Cobalt Strike](https://attack.mitre.org/software/S0154) can track key presses with a keylogger module.

Cobalt Strike.name: Commonly Used Port
Cobalt Strike.description: [Cobalt Strike](https://attack.mitre.org/software/S0154) uses a custom command and control protocol that communicates over commonly used ports. The C2 protocol is encapsulated in common application layer protocols.

Cobalt Strike.name: BITS Jobs
Cobalt Strike.description: [Cobalt Strike](https://attack.mitre.org/software/S0154) can download a hosted "beacon" payload using [BITSAdmin](https://attack.mitre.org/software/S0190).

Cobalt Strike.name: Process Hollowing
Cobalt Strike.description: [Cobalt Strike](https://attack.mitre.org/software/S0154) can use process hollowing for execution.

Cobalt Strike.name: Remote System Discovery
Cobalt Strike.description: [Cobalt Strike](https://attack.mitre.org/software/S0154) uses the native Windows Network Enumeration APIs to interrogate and discover targets in a Windows Active Directory network.

Cobalt Strike.name: Distributed Component Object Model
Cobalt Strike.description: [Cobalt Strike](https://attack.mitre.org/software/S0154) can deliver "beacon" payloads for lateral movement by leveraging remote COM execution.

Cobalt Strike.name: Network Share Discovery
Cobalt Strike.description: [Cobalt Strike](https://attack.mitre.org/software/S0154) can query shared drives on the local system.

Net.name: Service Execution
Net.description: The net start and net stop commands can be used in [Net](https://attack.mitre.org/software/S0039) to execute or stop Windows services.

Net.name: Network Share Discovery
Net.description: The net view \\remotesystem and net share commands in [Net](https://attack.mitre.org/software/S0039) can be used to find shared drives and directories on remote and local systems respectively.

Net.name: Account Discovery
Net.description: Commands under net user can be used in [Net](https://attack.mitre.org/software/S0039) to gather information about and manipulate user accounts.

Net.name: Create Account
Net.description: The net user username \password and net user username \password \domain commands in [Net](https://attack.mitre.org/software/S0039) can be used to create a local or domain account respectively.

Net.name: Windows Admin Shares
Net.description: Lateral movement can be done with [Net](https://attack.mitre.org/software/S0039) through net use commands to connect to the on remote systems.

Net.name: Permission Groups Discovery
Net.description: Commands such as net group and net localgroup can be used in [Net](https://attack.mitre.org/software/S0039) to gather information about and manipulate groups.

Net.name: System Service Discovery
Net.description: The net start command can be used in [Net](https://attack.mitre.org/software/S0039) to find information about Windows services.

Net.name: Remote System Discovery
Net.description: Commands such as net view can be used in [Net](https://attack.mitre.org/software/S0039) to gather information about available remote systems.

Net.name: System Network Connections Discovery
Net.description: Commands such as net use and net session can be used in [Net](https://attack.mitre.org/software/S0039) to gather information about network connections from a particular host.

Net.name: Password Policy Discovery
Net.description: The net accounts and net accounts /domain commands with [Net](https://attack.mitre.org/software/S0039) can be used to obtain password policy information.

Net.name: System Time Discovery
Net.description: The net time command can be used in [Net](https://attack.mitre.org/software/S0039) to determine the local or remote system time.

Net.name: Network Share Connection Removal
Net.description: The net use \\system\share /delete command can be used in [Net](https://attack.mitre.org/software/S0039) to remove an established connection to a network share.

Mimikatz.name: Security Support Provider
Mimikatz.description: The [Mimikatz](https://attack.mitre.org/software/S0002) credential dumper contains an implementation of an SSP.

Mimikatz.name: SID-History Injection
Mimikatz.description: [Mimikatz](https://attack.mitre.org/software/S0002)'s MISC::AddSid module can appended any SID or user/group account to a user's SID-History. [Mimikatz](https://attack.mitre.org/software/S0002) also utilizes [SID-History Injection](https://attack.mitre.org/techniques/T1178) to expand the scope of other components such as generated Kerberos Golden Tickets and DCSync beyond a single domain.

Mimikatz.name: Pass the Hash
Mimikatz.description: [Mimikatz](https://attack.mitre.org/software/S0002)'s SEKURLSA::Pth module can impersonate a user, with only a password hash, to execute arbitrary commands.

Mimikatz.name: DCShadow
Mimikatz.description: [Mimikatz](https://attack.mitre.org/software/S0002)’s LSADUMP::DCShadow module can be used to make AD updates by temporarily setting a computer to be a DC.

Mimikatz.name: Private Keys
Mimikatz.description: [Mimikatz](https://attack.mitre.org/software/S0002)'s CRYPTO::Extract module can extract keys by interacting with Windows cryptographic application programming interface (API) functions.

Mimikatz.name: Credentials in Files
Mimikatz.description: [Mimikatz](https://attack.mitre.org/software/S0002)'s DPAPI module can harvest protected credentials stored and/or cached by browsers and other user applications by interacting with Windows cryptographic application programming interface (API) functions.

Mimikatz.name: Pass the Ticket
Mimikatz.description: [Mimikatz](https://attack.mitre.org/software/S0002)’s LSADUMP::DCSync, KERBEROS::Golden, and KERBEROS::PTT modules implement the three steps required to extract the krbtgt account hash and create/use Kerberos tickets.

Mimikatz.name: Account Manipulation
Mimikatz.description: The [Mimikatz](https://attack.mitre.org/software/S0002) credential dumper has been extended to include Skeleton Key domain controller authentication bypass functionality. The LSADUMP::ChangeNTLM and LSADUMP::SetNTLM modules can also manipulate the password hash of an account without knowing the clear text value.

Mimikatz.name: Credential Dumping
Mimikatz.description: [Mimikatz](https://attack.mitre.org/software/S0002) performs credential dumping to obtain account and password information useful in gaining access to additional systems and enterprise network resources. It contains functionality to acquire information about credentials in many ways, including from the LSA, SAM table, credential vault, DCSync/NetSync, and DPAPI.

QuasarRAT.name: Remote Desktop Protocol
QuasarRAT.description: [QuasarRAT](https://attack.mitre.org/software/S0262) has a module for performing remote desktop access.

QuasarRAT.name: Remote File Copy
QuasarRAT.description: [QuasarRAT](https://attack.mitre.org/software/S0262) can download files to the victim’s machine and execute them.

QuasarRAT.name: Credentials in Files
QuasarRAT.description: [QuasarRAT](https://attack.mitre.org/software/S0262) can obtain passwords from FTP clients.

QuasarRAT.name: Credential Dumping
QuasarRAT.description: [QuasarRAT](https://attack.mitre.org/software/S0262) can obtain passwords from common browsers and FTP clients.

QuasarRAT.name: Command-Line Interface
QuasarRAT.description: [QuasarRAT](https://attack.mitre.org/software/S0262) can launch a remote shell to execute commands on the victim’s machine.

QuasarRAT.name: System Information Discovery
QuasarRAT.description: [QuasarRAT](https://attack.mitre.org/software/S0262) has a command to gather system information from the victim’s machine.

QuasarRAT.name: Standard Cryptographic Protocol
QuasarRAT.description: [QuasarRAT](https://attack.mitre.org/software/S0262) uses AES to encrypt network communication.

QuasarRAT.name: Modify Registry
QuasarRAT.description: [QuasarRAT](https://attack.mitre.org/software/S0262) has a command to edit the Registry on the victim’s machine.

QuasarRAT.name: Connection Proxy
QuasarRAT.description: [QuasarRAT](https://attack.mitre.org/software/S0262) can communicate over a reverse proxy using SOCKS5.

QuasarRAT.name: Masquerading
QuasarRAT.description: [QuasarRAT](https://attack.mitre.org/software/S0262) has dropped binaries as files named microsoft_network.exe and crome.exe.

QuasarRAT.name: Scheduled Task
QuasarRAT.description: [QuasarRAT](https://attack.mitre.org/software/S0262) contains a .NET wrapper DLL for creating and managing scheduled tasks for maintaining persistence upon reboot.

QuasarRAT.name: Code Signing
QuasarRAT.description: A [QuasarRAT](https://attack.mitre.org/software/S0262) .dll file is digitally signed by a certificate from AirVPN.

PowerSploit.name: Process Discovery
PowerSploit.description: [PowerSploit](https://attack.mitre.org/software/S0194)'s Get-ProcessTokenPrivilege Privesc-PowerUp module can enumerate privileges for a given process.

PowerSploit.name: Process Injection
PowerSploit.description: [PowerSploit](https://attack.mitre.org/software/S0194) contains a collection of CodeExecution modules that enable by injecting code (DLL, shellcode) or reflectively loading a Windows PE file into a process.

PowerSploit.name: Credentials in Registry
PowerSploit.description: [PowerSploit](https://attack.mitre.org/software/S0194) has several modules that search the Windows Registry for stored credentials: Get-UnattendedInstallFile, Get-Webconfig, Get-ApplicationHost, Get-SiteListPassword, Get-CachedGPPPassword, and Get-RegistryAutoLogon.

PowerSploit.name: Kerberoasting
PowerSploit.description: [PowerSploit](https://attack.mitre.org/software/S0194)'s Invoke-Kerberoast module can request service tickets and return crackable ticket hashes.

PowerSploit.name: Security Support Provider
PowerSploit.description: [PowerSploit](https://attack.mitre.org/software/S0194)'s Install-SSP Persistence module can be used to establish by installing a SSP DLL.

PowerSploit.name: Input Capture
PowerSploit.description: [PowerSploit](https://attack.mitre.org/software/S0194)'s Get-Keystrokes Exfiltration module can log keystrokes.

PowerSploit.name: Account Discovery
PowerSploit.description: [PowerSploit](https://attack.mitre.org/software/S0194)'s Get-ProcessTokenGroup Privesc-PowerUp module can enumerate all SIDs associated with its current token.

PowerSploit.name: Credential Dumping
PowerSploit.description: [PowerSploit](https://attack.mitre.org/software/S0194) contains a collection of Exfiltration modules that can harvest credentials from Group Policy Preferences, Windows vault credential objects, or using [Mimikatz](https://attack.mitre.org/software/S0002).

PowerSploit.name: Obfuscated Files or Information
PowerSploit.description: [PowerSploit](https://attack.mitre.org/software/S0194) contains a collection of ScriptModification modules that compress and encode scripts and payloads.

PowerSploit.name: Registry Run Keys / Startup Folder
PowerSploit.description: [PowerSploit](https://attack.mitre.org/software/S0194)'s New-UserPersistenceOption Persistence argument can be used to establish via the HKCU\SOFTWARE\Microsoft\Windows\CurrentVersion\Run Registry key.

PowerSploit.name: DLL Search Order Hijacking
PowerSploit.description: [PowerSploit](https://attack.mitre.org/software/S0194) contains a collection of Privesc-PowerUp modules that can discover and exploit DLL hijacking opportunities in services and processes.

PowerSploit.name: Path Interception
PowerSploit.description: [PowerSploit](https://attack.mitre.org/software/S0194) contains a collection of Privesc-PowerUp modules that can discover and exploit various path interception opportunities in services, processes, and variables.

PowerSploit.name: Indicator Removal from Tools
PowerSploit.description: [PowerSploit](https://attack.mitre.org/software/S0194)'s Find-AVSignature AntivirusBypass module can be used to locate single byte anti-virus signatures.

PowerSploit.name: Data from Local System
PowerSploit.description: [PowerSploit](https://attack.mitre.org/software/S0194) contains a collection of Exfiltration modules that can access data from local files, volumes, and processes.

PowerSploit.name: Modify Existing Service
PowerSploit.description: [PowerSploit](https://attack.mitre.org/software/S0194) contains a collection of Privesc-PowerUp modules that can discover and replace/modify service binaries, paths, and configs.

PowerSploit.name: Scheduled Task
PowerSploit.description: [PowerSploit](https://attack.mitre.org/software/S0194)'s New-UserPersistenceOption Persistence argument can be used to establish via a [Scheduled Task](https://attack.mitre.org/techniques/T1053).

PowerSploit.name: Access Token Manipulation
PowerSploit.description: [PowerSploit](https://attack.mitre.org/software/S0194)'s Invoke-TokenManipulation Exfiltration module can be used to locate and impersonate user logon tokens.

PowerSploit.name: PowerShell
PowerSploit.description: [PowerSploit](https://attack.mitre.org/software/S0194) modules are written in and executed via [PowerShell](https://attack.mitre.org/techniques/T1086).

PowerSploit.name: Query Registry
PowerSploit.description: [PowerSploit](https://attack.mitre.org/software/S0194) contains a collection of Privesc-PowerUp modules that can query Registry keys for potential opportunities.

PowerSploit.name: Audio Capture
PowerSploit.description: [PowerSploit](https://attack.mitre.org/software/S0194)'s Get-MicrophoneAudio Exfiltration module can record system microphone audio.

PowerSploit.name: Screen Capture
PowerSploit.description: [PowerSploit](https://attack.mitre.org/software/S0194)'s Get-TimedScreenshot Exfiltration module can take screenshots at regular intervals.

PowerSploit.name: Windows Management Instrumentation
PowerSploit.description: [PowerSploit](https://attack.mitre.org/software/S0194)'s Invoke-WmiCommand CodeExecution module uses WMI to execute and retrieve the output from a [PowerShell](https://attack.mitre.org/techniques/T1086) payload.

PowerSploit.name: Domain Trust Discovery
PowerSploit.description: [PowerSploit](https://attack.mitre.org/software/S0194) has modules such as Get-NetDomainTrust and Get-NetForestTrust to enumerate domain and forest trusts.

spwebmember.name: Data from Information Repositories
spwebmember.description: [spwebmember](https://attack.mitre.org/software/S0227) is used to enumerate and dump information from Microsoft SharePoint.

cmd.name: Command-Line Interface
cmd.description: [cmd](https://attack.mitre.org/software/S0106) is used to execute programs and other actions at the command-line interface.

cmd.name: File Deletion
cmd.description: [cmd](https://attack.mitre.org/software/S0106) can be used to delete files from the file system.

cmd.name: Remote File Copy
cmd.description: [cmd](https://attack.mitre.org/software/S0106) can be used to copy files to a remotely connected system.

cmd.name: File and Directory Discovery
cmd.description: [cmd](https://attack.mitre.org/software/S0106) can be used to find files and directories with native functionality such as dir commands.

cmd.name: System Information Discovery
cmd.description: [cmd](https://attack.mitre.org/software/S0106) can be used to find information about the operating system.

Remcos.name: Virtualization/Sandbox Evasion
Remcos.description: [Remcos](https://attack.mitre.org/software/S0332) searches for Sandboxie and VMware on the system.

Remcos.name: Audio Capture
Remcos.description: [Remcos](https://attack.mitre.org/software/S0332) can capture data from the system’s microphone.

Remcos.name: Video Capture
Remcos.description: [Remcos](https://attack.mitre.org/software/S0332) can access a system’s webcam and take pictures.

Remcos.name: Connection Proxy

Remcos.name: Bypass User Account Control
Remcos.description: [Remcos](https://attack.mitre.org/software/S0332) has a command for UAC bypassing.

Remcos.name: Process Injection
Remcos.description: [Remcos](https://attack.mitre.org/software/S0332) has a command to hide itself through injecting into another process.

Remcos.name: File and Directory Discovery
Remcos.description: [Remcos](https://attack.mitre.org/software/S0332) can search for files on the infected machine.

Remcos.name: Screen Capture
Remcos.description: [Remcos](https://attack.mitre.org/software/S0332) takes automated screenshots of the infected machine.

Remcos.name: Clipboard Data
Remcos.description: [Remcos](https://attack.mitre.org/software/S0332) steals and modifies data from the clipboard.

Remcos.name: Modify Registry
Remcos.description: [Remcos](https://attack.mitre.org/software/S0332) has full control of the Registry, including the ability to modify it.

Remcos.name: Obfuscated Files or Information
Remcos.description: [Remcos](https://attack.mitre.org/software/S0332) uses RC4 and base64 to obfuscate data, including Registry entries and file paths.

Remcos.name: Registry Run Keys / Startup Folder
Remcos.description: [Remcos](https://attack.mitre.org/software/S0332) can add itself to the Registry key HKCU\Software\Microsoft\Windows\CurrentVersion\Run for persistence.

Koadic.name: Standard Cryptographic Protocol

Koadic.name: Service Execution

Koadic.name: Remote Desktop Protocol

Koadic.name: Clipboard Data

Koadic.name: Network Share Discovery

Koadic.name: Command-Line Interface

Koadic.name: Windows Management Instrumentation
Koadic.description: [Koadic](https://attack.mitre.org/software/S0250) can use WMI to execute commands.

Koadic.name: Data from Local System
Koadic.description: [Koadic](https://attack.mitre.org/software/S0250) can download files off the target system to send back to the server.

Koadic.name: Credential Dumping
Koadic.description: [Koadic](https://attack.mitre.org/software/S0250) can gather hashed passwords by dumping SAM/SECURITY hive and gathers domain controller hashes from NTDS.

Koadic.name: Mshta
Koadic.description: [Koadic](https://attack.mitre.org/software/S0250) can use MSHTA to serve additional payloads.

Koadic.name: Regsvr32
Koadic.description: [Koadic](https://attack.mitre.org/software/S0250) can use Regsvr32 to execute additional payloads.

Koadic.name: Bypass User Account Control
Koadic.description: [Koadic](https://attack.mitre.org/software/S0250) has 2 methods for elevating integrity. It can bypass UAC through eventvwr.exe and sdclt.exe.

Koadic.name: Scripting
Koadic.description: [Koadic](https://attack.mitre.org/software/S0250) performs most of its operations using Windows Script Host (Jscript and VBScript) and runs arbitrary shellcode .

Koadic.name: System Owner/User Discovery
Koadic.description: [Koadic](https://attack.mitre.org/software/S0250) can identify logged in users across the domain and views user sessions.

LaZagne.name: Credential Dumping
LaZagne.description: [LaZagne](https://attack.mitre.org/software/S0349) can perform credential dumping to obtain account and password information.

LaZagne.name: Credentials in Files

certutil.name: Install Root Certificate
certutil.description: [certutil](https://attack.mitre.org/software/S0160) can be used to install browser root certificates as a precursor to performing man-in-the-middle between connections to banking websites. Example command: certutil -addstore -f -user ROOT ProgramData\cert512121.der.

certutil.name: Deobfuscate/Decode Files or Information

certutil.name: Remote File Copy

Reg.name: Query Registry

Reg.name: Credentials in Registry

ifconfig.name: System Network Configuration Discovery

dsquery.name: Domain Trust Discovery

ipconfig.name: System Network Configuration Discovery
ipconfig.description: [ipconfig](https://attack.mitre.org/software/S0100) can be used to display adapter configuration on Windows systems, including information for TCP/IP, DNS, and DHCP.

HTRAN.name: Connection Proxy

HTRAN.name: Process Injection

HTRAN.name: Rootkit
HTRAN.description: [HTRAN](https://attack.mitre.org/software/S0040) can install a rootkit to hide network connections from the host OS.

Lslsass.name: Credential Dumping
Lslsass.description: [Lslsass](https://attack.mitre.org/software/S0121) can dump active logon session password hashes from the lsass process.

PsExec.name: Windows Admin Shares
PsExec.description: [PsExec](https://attack.mitre.org/software/S0029), a tool that has been used by adversaries, writes programs to the ADMIN$ network share to execute commands on remote systems.

PsExec.name: Service Execution
PsExec.description: Microsoft Sysinternals [PsExec](https://attack.mitre.org/software/S0029) is a popular administration tool that can be used to execute binaries on remote systems using a temporary Windows service.

Arp.name: System Network Configuration Discovery
Arp.description: [Arp](https://attack.mitre.org/software/S0099) can be used to display ARP configuration information on the host.

netsh.name: Security Software Discovery
netsh.description: [netsh](https://attack.mitre.org/software/S0108) can be used to discover system firewall settings.

netsh.name: Disabling Security Tools

netsh.name: Connection Proxy
netsh.description: [netsh](https://attack.mitre.org/software/S0108) can be used to set up a proxy tunnel to allow remote host access to an infected host.

netsh.name: Netsh Helper DLL
netsh.description: [netsh](https://attack.mitre.org/software/S0108) can be used as a persistence proxy technique to execute a helper DLL when netsh.exe is executed.

meek.name: Domain Fronting
meek.description: [meek](https://attack.mitre.org/software/S0175) uses Domain Fronting to disguise the destination of network traffic as another server that is hosted in the same Content Delivery Network (CDN) as the intended desitnation.

Cachedump.name: Credential Dumping

gsecdump.name: Credential Dumping
gsecdump.description: [gsecdump](https://attack.mitre.org/software/S0008) can dump Windows password hashes and LSA secrets.

UACMe.name: Bypass User Account Control
UACMe.description: [UACMe](https://attack.mitre.org/software/S0116) contains many methods for bypassing Windows User Account Control on multiple versions of the operating system.

Havij.name: Exploit Public-Facing Application

nbtstat.name: System Network Connections Discovery

nbtstat.name: System Network Configuration Discovery

Impacket.name: Kerberoasting
Impacket.description: [Impacket](https://attack.mitre.org/software/S0357) modules like GetUserSPNs can be used to get Service Principal Names (SPNs) for user accounts. The output is formatted to be compatible with cracking tools like John the Ripper and Hashcat.

Impacket.name: Service Execution
Impacket.description: [Impacket](https://attack.mitre.org/software/S0357) contains various modules emulating other service execution tools such as [PsExec](https://attack.mitre.org/software/S0029).

Impacket.name: Windows Management Instrumentation
Impacket.description: [Impacket](https://attack.mitre.org/software/S0357)'s wmiexec module can be used to execute commands through WMI.

Impacket.name: LLMNR/NBT-NS Poisoning and Relay

Responder.name: Network Sniffing
Responder.description: [Responder](https://attack.mitre.org/software/S0174) captures hashes and credentials that are sent to the system after the name services have been poisoned.

Responder.name: LLMNR/NBT-NS Poisoning and Relay
Responder.description: [Responder](https://attack.mitre.org/software/S0174) is used to poison name services to gather hashes and credentials from systems within a local network.

Tor.name: Multilayer Encryption
Tor.description: [Tor](https://attack.mitre.org/software/S0183) encapsulates traffic in multiple layers of encryption.

Tor.name: Multi-hop Proxy
Tor.description: Traffic traversing the [Tor](https://attack.mitre.org/software/S0183) network will be forwarded to multiple nodes before exiting the [Tor](https://attack.mitre.org/software/S0183) network and continuing on to its intended destination.

Tasklist.name: Security Software Discovery

SDelete.description: [SDelete](https://attack.mitre.org/software/S0195) deletes data in a way that makes it unrecoverable.

Ruler.description: [Ruler](https://attack.mitre.org/software/S0358) can be used to enumerate Exchange users and dump the GAL.

Nltest.description: [Nltest](https://attack.mitre.org/software/S0359) may be used to enumerate the parent domain of a local machine using /parentdomain.

Expand.name: NTFS File Attributes

Empire.name: Browser Bookmark Discovery
Empire.description: [Empire](https://attack.mitre.org/software/S0363) has the ability to gather browser data such as bookmarks and visited sites.

Empire.name: Input Capture
Empire.description: [Empire](https://attack.mitre.org/software/S0363) includes keylogging capabilities for Windows, Linux, and macOS systems.

Empire.name: Credentials in Files
Empire.description: [Empire](https://attack.mitre.org/software/S0363) can use various modules to search for files containing passwords.

Empire.name: Credential Dumping
Empire.description: [Empire](https://attack.mitre.org/software/S0363) contains an implementation of [Mimikatz](https://attack.mitre.org/software/S0002) to gather credentials from memory.

Empire.name: Video Capture
Empire.description: [Empire](https://attack.mitre.org/software/S0363) can capture webcam data on Windows and macOS systems.

Empire.name: Scripting
Empire.description: [Empire](https://attack.mitre.org/software/S0363) has modules for executing scripts.

Empire.name: Process Injection
Empire.description: [Empire](https://attack.mitre.org/software/S0363) contains multiple modules for injecting into processes, such as Invoke-PSInject.

Empire.name: File and Directory Discovery
Empire.description: [Empire](https://attack.mitre.org/software/S0363) includes various modules for finding files of interest on hosts and network shares.

Empire.name: Clipboard Data
Empire.description: [Empire](https://attack.mitre.org/software/S0363) can harvest clipboard data on both Windows and macOS systems.

Empire.name: Pass the Ticket
Empire.description: [Empire](https://attack.mitre.org/software/S0363) can leverage its implementation of [Mimikatz](https://attack.mitre.org/software/S0002) to obtain and use Silver and Golden Tickets.

Empire.name: Private Keys
Empire.description: [Empire](https://attack.mitre.org/software/S0363) can use modules like Invoke-SessionGopher to extract private key and session information.

Empire.name: Kerberoasting
Empire.description: [Empire](https://attack.mitre.org/software/S0363) uses [PowerSploit](https://attack.mitre.org/software/S0194)'s Invoke-Kerberoast to request service tickets and return crackable ticket hashes.

Empire.name: Screen Capture
Empire.description: [Empire](https://attack.mitre.org/software/S0363) is capable of capturing screenshots on Windows and macOS systems.

Empire.name: Network Sniffing
Empire.description: [Empire](https://attack.mitre.org/software/S0363) can be used to conduct packet captures on target hosts.

Empire.name: LLMNR/NBT-NS Poisoning and Relay
Empire.description: [Empire](https://attack.mitre.org/software/S0363) can use Inveigh to conduct name service poisoning for credential theft and associated relay attacks.

Empire.name: Hooking
Empire.description: [Empire](https://attack.mitre.org/software/S0363) contains some modules that leverage API hooking to carry out tasks, such as netripper.

Empire.name: Command-Line Interface
Empire.description: [Empire](https://attack.mitre.org/software/S0363) uses a command-line interface to interact with systems.

Empire.name: PowerShell
Empire.description: [Empire](https://attack.mitre.org/software/S0363) leverages PowerShell for the majority of its client-side agent tasks. [Empire](https://attack.mitre.org/software/S0363) also contains the ability to conduct PowerShell remoting with the Invoke-PSRemoting module.

Empire.name: Service Execution
Empire.description: [Empire](https://attack.mitre.org/software/S0363) can use [PsExec](https://attack.mitre.org/software/S0029) to execute a payload on a remote host.

Empire.name: Trusted Developer Utilities
Empire.description: [Empire](https://attack.mitre.org/software/S0363) can use built-in modules to abuse trusted utilities like MSBuild.exe.

Empire.name: Distributed Component Object Model
Empire.description: [Empire](https://attack.mitre.org/software/S0363) can utilize Invoke-DCOM to leverage remote COM execution for lateral movement.

Empire.name: Exploitation of Remote Services
Empire.description: [Empire](https://attack.mitre.org/software/S0363) has a limited number of built-in modules for exploiting remote SMB, JBoss, and Jenkins servers.

Empire.name: Access Token Manipulation
Empire.description: [Empire](https://attack.mitre.org/software/S0363) can use Invoke-RunAs to make tokens as well as [PowerSploit](https://attack.mitre.org/software/S0194)'s Invoke-TokenManipulation to manipulate access tokens.

Empire.name: Pass the Hash
Empire.description: [Empire](https://attack.mitre.org/software/S0363) can perform pass the hash attacks.

Empire.name: Remote Services
Empire.description: [Empire](https://attack.mitre.org/software/S0363) contains modules for executing commands over SSH as well as in-memory VNC agent injection.

Empire.name: Scheduled Task
Empire.description: [Empire](https://attack.mitre.org/software/S0363) has modules to interact with the Windows task scheduler.

Empire.name: Windows Management Instrumentation
Empire.description: [Empire](https://attack.mitre.org/software/S0363) can use WMI to deliver a payload to a remote host.

Empire.name: Accessibility Features
Empire.description: [Empire](https://attack.mitre.org/software/S0363) can leverage WMI debugging to remotely replace binaries like sethc.exe, Utilman.exe, and Magnify.exe with cmd.exe.

Empire.name: Network Service Scanning
Empire.description: [Empire](https://attack.mitre.org/software/S0363) can perform port scans from an infected host.

Empire.name: DLL Search Order Hijacking
Empire.description: [Empire](https://attack.mitre.org/software/S0363) contains modules that can discover and exploit various DLL hijacking opportunities.

Empire.name: Path Interception
Empire.description: [Empire](https://attack.mitre.org/software/S0363) contains modules that can discover and exploit various path interception opportunities.

Empire.name: Modify Existing Service
Empire.description: [Empire](https://attack.mitre.org/software/S0363) can utilize built-in modules to modify service binaries and restore them to their original state.

Empire.name: Exploitation for Privilege Escalation
Empire.description: [Empire](https://attack.mitre.org/software/S0363) can exploit vulnerabilities such as MS16-032 and MS16-135.

Empire.name: Security Support Provider
Empire.description: [Empire](https://attack.mitre.org/software/S0363) can enumerate Security Support Providers (SSPs) as well as utilize [PowerSploit](https://attack.mitre.org/software/S0194)'s Install-SSP and Invoke-Mimikatz to install malicious SSPs and log authentication events.

Empire.name: Bypass User Account Control
Empire.description: [Empire](https://attack.mitre.org/software/S0363) includes various modules to attempt to bypass UAC for escalation of privileges.

Empire.name: SID-History Injection
Empire.description: [Empire](https://attack.mitre.org/software/S0363) can add a SID-History to a user if on a domain controller.

Empire.name: Shortcut Modification
Empire.description: [Empire](https://attack.mitre.org/software/S0363) can persist by modifying a .LNK file to include a backdoor.

Empire.name: Create Account
Empire.description: [Empire](https://attack.mitre.org/software/S0363) has a module for creating a new domain user or local user if permissions allow.

Empire.name: Data Compressed
Empire.description: [Empire](https://attack.mitre.org/software/S0363) can ZIP directories on the target system.

Empire.name: Email Collection
Empire.description: [Empire](https://attack.mitre.org/software/S0363) has the ability to collect emails on a target system.

Empire.name: Timestomp
Empire.description: [Empire](https://attack.mitre.org/software/S0363) can timestomp any files or payloads placed on a target machine to help them blend in.

Empire.name: Registry Run Keys / Startup Folder
Empire.description: [Empire](https://attack.mitre.org/software/S0363) can modify the registry run keys HKEY_CURRENT_USER\Software\Microsoft\Windows\CurrentVersion\Run and HKEY_LOCAL_MACHINE\Software\Microsoft\Windows\CurrentVersion\Run for persistence.

Empire.name: Account Discovery
Empire.description: [Empire](https://attack.mitre.org/software/S0363) can acquire local and domain user account information.

Empire.name: Standard Application Layer Protocol
Empire.description: [Empire](https://attack.mitre.org/software/S0363) can conduct command and control over protocols like HTTP and HTTPS.

Empire.name: Commonly Used Port
Empire.description: [Empire](https://attack.mitre.org/software/S0363) can conduct command and control over commonly used ports like 80 and 443.

Empire.name: Exfiltration Over Alternative Protocol
Empire.description: [Empire](https://attack.mitre.org/software/S0363) can use Dropbox and GitHub for data exfiltration.

Empire.name: Exfiltration Over Command and Control Channel
Empire.description: [Empire](https://attack.mitre.org/software/S0363) can send data gathered from a target through the command and control channel.

Empire.name: Network Share Discovery
Empire.description: [Empire](https://attack.mitre.org/software/S0363) can find shared drives on the local system.

Empire.name: Process Discovery
Empire.description: [Empire](https://attack.mitre.org/software/S0363) can find information about processes running on local and remote systems.

Empire.name: System Network Connections Discovery
Empire.description: [Empire](https://attack.mitre.org/software/S0363) can enumerate the current network connections of a host.

Empire.name: System Network Configuration Discovery
Empire.description: [Empire](https://attack.mitre.org/software/S0363) can acquire network configuration information like DNS servers and network proxies used by a host.

Empire.name: System Information Discovery
Empire.description: [Empire](https://attack.mitre.org/software/S0363) can enumerate host system information like OS, architecture, applied patches, and more.

Empire.name: Security Software Discovery
Empire.description: [Empire](https://attack.mitre.org/software/S0363) can enumerate antivirus software on the target.

Empire.name: Standard Cryptographic Protocol
Empire.description: [Empire](https://attack.mitre.org/software/S0363) can use TLS to encrypt its C2 channel.

Empire.name: Remote File Copy
Empire.description: [Empire](https://attack.mitre.org/software/S0363) can upload and download to and from a victim machine.

Empire.name: Execution through API
Empire.description: [Empire](https://attack.mitre.org/software/S0363) contains a variety of enumeration modules that have an option to use API calls to carry out tasks.

Empire.name: Obfuscated Files or Information
Empire.description: [Empire](https://attack.mitre.org/software/S0363) has the ability to obfuscate commands using Invoke-Obfuscation.

Empire.name: Group Policy Modification
Empire.description: [Empire](https://attack.mitre.org/software/S0363) can use New-GPOImmediateTask to modify a GPO that will install and execute a malicious [Scheduled Task](https://attack.mitre.org/techniques/T1053).

Empire.name: Web Service
Empire.description: [Empire](https://attack.mitre.org/software/S0363) can use Dropbox and GitHub for C2.

Empire.name: Domain Trust Discovery
Empire.description: [Empire](https://attack.mitre.org/software/S0363) has modules for enumerating domain trusts.

RawDisk.name: Disk Structure Wipe
RawDisk.description: [RawDisk](https://attack.mitre.org/software/S0364) was used in [Shamoon](https://attack.mitre.org/software/S0140) to help overwrite components of disk structure like the MBR and disk partitions.

RawDisk.name: Data Destruction
RawDisk.description: [RawDisk](https://attack.mitre.org/software/S0364) was used in [Shamoon](https://attack.mitre.org/software/S0140) to write to protected system locations such as the MBR and disk partitions in an effort to destroy data.

RawDisk.name: Disk Content Wipe
RawDisk.description: [RawDisk](https://attack.mitre.org/software/S0364) has been used to directly access the hard disk to help overwrite arbitrarily sized portions of disk content.

PoshC2.name: Brute Force
PoshC2.description: [PoshC2](https://attack.mitre.org/software/S0378) has modules for brute forcing local administrator and AD user accounts.

PoshC2.name: Domain Trust Discovery
PoshC2.description: [PoshC2](https://attack.mitre.org/software/S0378) has modules for enumerating domain trusts.

PoshC2.name: LLMNR/NBT-NS Poisoning and Relay
PoshC2.description: [PoshC2](https://attack.mitre.org/software/S0378) can use Inveigh to conduct name service poisoning for credential theft and associated relay attacks.

PoshC2.name: Exploitation of Remote Services
PoshC2.description: [PoshC2](https://attack.mitre.org/software/S0378) contains a module for exploiting SMB via EternalBlue.

PoshC2.name: Automated Collection
PoshC2.description: [PoshC2](https://attack.mitre.org/software/S0378) contains a module for recursively parsing through files and directories to gather valid credit card numbers.

PoshC2.name: Bypass User Account Control
PoshC2.description: [PoshC2](https://attack.mitre.org/software/S0378) can utilize multiple methods to bypass UAC.

PoshC2.name: Input Capture
PoshC2.description: [PoshC2](https://attack.mitre.org/software/S0378) has modules for keystroke logging and capturing credentials from spoofed Outlook authentication messages.

PoshC2.name: Exploitation for Privilege Escalation
PoshC2.description: [PoshC2](https://attack.mitre.org/software/S0378) contains modules for local privilege escalation exploits such as CVE-2016-9192 and CVE-2016-0099.

PoshC2.name: Process Injection
PoshC2.description: [PoshC2](https://attack.mitre.org/software/S0378) contains multiple modules for injecting into processes, such as Invoke-PSInject.

PoshC2.name: Access Token Manipulation
PoshC2.description: [PoshC2](https://attack.mitre.org/software/S0378) contains a number of modules, such as Invoke-RunAs and Invoke-TokenManipulation, for manipulating tokens.

PoshC2.name: Pass the Hash
PoshC2.description: [PoshC2](https://attack.mitre.org/software/S0378) has a number of modules that leverage pass the hash for lateral movement.

PoshC2.name: Connection Proxy
PoshC2.description: [PoshC2](https://attack.mitre.org/software/S0378) contains modules that allow for use of proxies in command and control.

PoshC2.name: Windows Management Instrumentation Event Subscription
PoshC2.description: [PoshC2](https://attack.mitre.org/software/S0378) has the ability to persist on a system using WMI events.

PoshC2.name: Windows Management Instrumentation
PoshC2.description: [PoshC2](https://attack.mitre.org/software/S0378) has a number of modules that use WMI to execute tasks.

PoshC2.name: Credential Dumping
PoshC2.description: [PoshC2](https://attack.mitre.org/software/S0378) contains an implementation of [Mimikatz](https://attack.mitre.org/software/S0002) to gather credentials from memory.

PoshC2.name: Credentials in Files
PoshC2.description: [PoshC2](https://attack.mitre.org/software/S0378) contains modules for searching for passwords in local and remote files.

PoshC2.name: Data Compressed
PoshC2.description: [PoshC2](https://attack.mitre.org/software/S0378) contains a module for compressing data using ZIP.

PoshC2.name: Service Execution
PoshC2.description: [PoshC2](https://attack.mitre.org/software/S0378) contains an implementation of [PsExec](https://attack.mitre.org/software/S0029) for remote execution.

PoshC2.name: System Service Discovery
PoshC2.description: [PoshC2](https://attack.mitre.org/software/S0378) can enumerate service and service permission information.

PoshC2.name: System Network Connections Discovery
PoshC2.description: [PoshC2](https://attack.mitre.org/software/S0378) contains an implementation of [netstat](https://attack.mitre.org/software/S0104) to enumerate TCP and UDP connections.

PoshC2.name: System Network Configuration Discovery
PoshC2.description: [PoshC2](https://attack.mitre.org/software/S0378) can enumerate network adapter information.

PoshC2.name: System Information Discovery
PoshC2.description: [PoshC2](https://attack.mitre.org/software/S0378) contains modules, such as Get-ComputerInfo, for enumerating common system information.

PoshC2.name: Permission Groups Discovery
PoshC2.description: [PoshC2](https://attack.mitre.org/software/S0378) contains modules, such as Get-LocAdm for enumerating permission groups.

PoshC2.name: Password Policy Discovery
PoshC2.description: [PoshC2](https://attack.mitre.org/software/S0378) can use Get-PassPol to enumerate the domain password policy.

PoshC2.name: Network Service Scanning
PoshC2.description: [PoshC2](https://attack.mitre.org/software/S0378) can perform port scans from an infected host.

PoshC2.name: Network Sniffing
PoshC2.description: [PoshC2](https://attack.mitre.org/software/S0378) contains a module for taking packet captures on compromised hosts.

PoshC2.name: Account Discovery
PoshC2.description: [PoshC2](https://attack.mitre.org/software/S0378) can enumerate local and domain user account information.

PoshC2.name: File and Directory Discovery
PoshC2.description: [PoshC2](https://attack.mitre.org/software/S0378) can enumerate files on the local file system and includes a module for enumerating recently accessed files.

PoshC2.name: Standard Application Layer Protocol
PoshC2.description: [PoshC2](https://attack.mitre.org/software/S0378) can use protocols like HTTP/HTTPS for command and control traffic.
